Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: Walter027
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I recently came to New Orleans to watch a football in the Big Easy. We stayed at the Double Tree. The staff was very pleasant and responsive to our requests. We had no problems with the workings of the hotel. Also Double Tree provides easy access to the French Quarter, Bourbon Street and the Superdome which made it a good choice for our trip. Harraha and the Aquarium of the Americas are also very close. I must address the condition or the hotel, however. This location is certainly in need of some renovations. Peeling paint, wall cracks, mold in the shower and moldy smelling carpets all led me to one conclusion. While I was not unhappy with the hotel in general, better hotels are available in New Orleans in this price range in locations that are at least as good. So while i had a great trip, i would not stay here on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Were Fair and Nice During Hurricane”
Reviews.Author: edra45
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the hotel before and after a cruise as part of a package deal with the cruise line. Hurricane Isaac came and the port closed and we were stuck. The hotel was very nice and gave us a very low rate instead of trying to take advantage of us. They even let us â€œplay-it-by-earâ€� and see day by day if we were going to be there, dependent on what happened with the port and the cruise line. The hotel location is great if you are going on a cruise (close to the port) and across from the casino. But if you want to see the French Quarter, it is a bit of a walk, and you might be better off staying in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kvince08
Reviews.Content: Great location and outstanding service! Only complaint was the quietness of the rooms. The hotel is older and the walls are paper thin and small. You can hear the room next door using their key machine. When other guests were walking by, it sounded like they were in your room it was so loud.We had to keep the restroom door closed at all times, when we would run the faucet or flush the toilet, a horrible sewer smell would come out, very strong! Good stay over all, just very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Was there for confernece. The hotel was very pleasant and ther service was very good. Very friendly staff. The rooms and all areas of the hotel were kept very clean. The hotel was located close to all the attractions,ie french Quarter, Harrah's Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chaswyck
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be beaten! We stayed for seven nights from 8/11/12 to 8/18/12. It was across the street from the start of the French Quarter, about a five minute walk from Bourbon Street, across the street from the Canal Street streetcar and an upscale shopping mall with an equally upscale movie theater, and literally steps (about 50) away from Harrah's Casino. The streetcar stop being right in front of the hotel was a huge convenience as we took the streetcars every day (buy the $3 pp all day pass - you'll need exact change, but a $5 and a $1 will do). We absolutely loved the location of this hotel. It couldn't have been better. The front desk staff was very friendly and greeted us every day. The room was quiet and very well appointed, but a bit small. It is a downtown hotel after all so this is to be expected. Besides, we spent very little time in the room during our stay. As other have said, the bathroom was small, but manageable. There was a full length mirror just outside the bathroom and the hair dryer cord reached it so two people could get ready at the same time with a little planning. Our only complaint was a musty/mildew smell that happened about day three (the only reason I didn't give the hotel 5 stars). We asked the housekeeper to spray a room deodorant each day and that kept the smell at bay for the rest of our trip. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable (among the best we have ever had in a hotel) and the bed linens were of high quality. We would highly recommend this hotel, but if there are more than two of you traveling, the room will likely be too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: yamativa
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was excellent. We stayed for 4 days. It was very close to main attractions, i.e. French Market, Audobon Aquarium, restaurants, etc. The buses and streetcars were walking distance. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and we had a good amount of clean fairly new towels.

Reviews.Title: “"Not for the business traveler"”
Reviews.Author: ultrakev
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the casinos and shopping mall which sounds convenient until you try to drive through the throngs of tourists to check in. Valet parking was overwhelmed when I arrived with very little space to stage the cars. The front desk initially sent me to a room that was locked from the inside. When I asked for another room, I was told I would be downgraded to a much smaller room at the same price. The room was a great example of a Doubletree- nice bed and linens, fine high def tv and clean. For some reason the counter in the bathroom was so low that I almost had to kneel to shave in the morning. (I am 6' 2" tall). The major downside to this hotel is the noise level at night- rowdy tourists in the hallway, ice machines, surrounding rooms. The building itself seems dated and is not well sound insulated. The fourth floor is also the pool deck which is much more popular with smokers than swimmers. More foot traffic through the night. The restaurant food is good, but be prepared to look for a server when you need a drink refill or the check. Typical laconic New Orleans service. This is not a hotel for the business traveler, it is geared toward the tourist trade.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Kimboater
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean but the walls are thin, as I have seen in other reviews. It did get a little noisy at night, but it wasn't that bad. The bathroom was small, but again clean. Harrah's is right across the street - a lot of fun! World of wings is attached to the hotel. The food was really good but it took over 45 mins to get it when there was only one other table. Staff at the hotel was great. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: RobertL
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to New Orleans and not my last. The Doubletree is in a fantastic location next to Harrahâ€™s and 100 feet from a Trolley stop. You can get to any of the great locations from here including anything on Canal, Bourbon Street, river walk and St. Charles garden district within a minute. The price is low compared to others in the area. The front desk staff is very helpful as well as the bell desk and valets outside. There are restaurants in the hotel and a convenience store on the corner. My only complaint is the parking, which is not the hotel's fault. So, take my advice. I drove around for an hour looking for parking. Have the valet do it for you so you can get out and see the sites. And if you're not from the South, take a towel with you. You'll need it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pldhund
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Friday, August 3rd, at about 6 pm. We were in a hurry to get to the McGraw/Chesney concert and were running late because of the traffic. The hotel staff was very professional and got us checked in quickly. The room wasn't anything special, but the property is located on Canal, across the street from Harrah's and within walking distance of the French Quarter. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Rodo O
Reviews.Content: I stayed from August 3rd-6th , 2012. Location: It is close to Riverwalk, the French Quarter, the Aquarium, and the street cars. Rate : A Sleep Quality: It is an old hotel, so you can hear when people are waking in the hallways, opening the rooms, chatting in the rooms, and any possible noise. Rate : F Rooms: Ok matress, 42 fllat tv with cable, no mini bars, old iron that stained my clothes. Rate; C

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: missdaisy98006
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubletree for a 5 day trip. To keep my review short and simple. This is what happened. We reserved a king bed, they gave us a queen without notifiying us During our entire trip, there was construction in the building that would start at 7am so sleep was disturbed. I asked the front desk about it and they did not offer anything to make it okay. I would not return to this hotel. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “expected better”
Reviews.Author: liz l
Reviews.Content: Other than the location of the hotel and the bartender Paster, there is nothing great about this hotel. The hallways have a musty smell. The bathroom is VERY VERY small (step out of the bathtub and your foot is on the toilet). we were there for 3 nights and they never changed the sheets untill we requested them to. There was no toothpaste, shower cap, the towels were old ). There was $125 credit card overcharge that no one can explain why(still waiting for a refund) ..I expected better especially being hilton affiliated

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: Ty W
Reviews.Content: If it were not for the great location this rating would have been a 1. Other than the location this hotel sucked. The hallway smelled like a dirty ashtray and our room was worse. There was mold/mildew on the vent and on the walls along with waterspots. The bathroom was dirty and the toilet looked as if it had not been cleaned (the bathroom was also very small). Fortunately, when I travel I bring my own cleaning supplies so I was able to clean it to a point where my husband and I were willing to stay. As Hilton Honors members, we were very disappointed that this hotel is apart of the Hilton chain. Parking is very expensive so be prepared. To make it worse, at checkout we had to wait for an hour to get our car from valet. I have pictures but I'm unable to upload them on the site.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Forest Hills, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: Nsholcman18
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just okay. The amenities were nothing special but the location was awesome! The staff was very helpful in general. One complaint that I have is one night security came up to my room at 9:00 pm complaining that they could hear us from the elevator it was very strange and made us feel uncomfortable because we were not being that loud.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter/Riverside location”
Reviews.Author: ghark
Reviews.Content: Attended a church convention and was assigned accommodations at the Doubletree. Great location on the edge of the French Quarter, close to the river and the casino. Plenty of good places to eat nearby - one attached to the hotel. Try Pinkberry for frozen yogurt treats! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious; beds very comfortable. Great warm chocolate chip cookies on check-in. No breakfast included - but there is a coffee shop off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mark E
Reviews.Content: After checking into our room, we at lunch decided to eat lunch in the hotel restaurant (WOW CafÃ©) because it was raining outside. The restaurant was busy at 2pm. It took an hour to get our food and no one in our family liked their food. This was the worst hamburger Iâ€™ve ever had - the meat was over cooked and had no seasoning/taste. My son had ribs and they tasted awful. The hotel was located in the heart of New Orleans. After a day of site seeing, we returned back to the hotel and tried to get the kids to bed by 10pm. However, the walls were paper thin. We could hear people talking in the hallway until midnight (one group would leave, another group would come back). We couldn't sleep because of the paper thin walls. The next morning we had breakfast in the hotel because we had some breakfast buffet coupons for the adults. It was served in lobby area across from the WOW CafÃ©. The food was your typical buffet with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, cereal, etc. When we got the bill, the kids buffet was $18. (We questioned the price and were told that was the correct price for a kid under 12). Overall, I would not recommend this hotel. We paid over $250/night for a room near the Aquarium and French Quarters. However, the location is not worth the money if you canâ€™t get a good nightâ€™s sleep because of paper thin walls or decent food at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing customer service”
Reviews.Author: mcgoldrickslowfood
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler I book travel every week so when planning a personal trip for me and 2 friends to NOLA it was simple. 1 friend had to cancel so upon canceling her room with the hotel the hotel cancelled my other friends room too. I was the first to arrive and the only 1 with a room. The hotel was over booked, couldn't help and wouldn't refer me to any other Hilton properties. Nice way to start a mini vacation. BTW there is a 36,000 conference in town and many of the rooms are booked. I jumped on line and called the Marriott across the street and they were helpful. I moved there and my friend stayed in my room. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for business or pleasure not only because of the customer service but it needs an update. I also lost the one night free using points which I was happy to pass onto my friend but added 200.00 to my cost.

Reviews.Title: “As good as other Doubletree experiences”
Reviews.Author: djlund999
Reviews.Content: Hadn't read any previous reviews, so wasn't expecting any specific positives or negatives. Check-in experience could have been smoother; lack of the room I had requested, and the 'upgrade' that was provided to soften the impact, were not well explained. The front-desk staff throughout the stay were "reserved" (i.e., spoke only when spoken to, and barely helpful). Room was very nice - spacious, clean, everything worked. Towels were oversized and thick, bucking the trend in other hotels. .

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: carterkatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Doubletree for 4 nights in July 2012. I was apprehensive after reading many of the comments. We had a very pleasant experience there. I think they are trying to address the "thin walls" with polite signs in the halls about "quiet hours" (reminded me of college!). Every single employee we dealt with was very personable and polite. We got our car from the valet parking several times. We would call from our room, ask for it and by the time we got downstairs, it was ready. We never had any problems with the elevators either. They were very prompt. Yes, the rooms are smaller that at some other hotels. But, considering it's an older building right near the river, French Quarter, etc. it's not that surprising. I would stay there again, and I'm pretty picky! LOL!

Reviews.Title: “Essence Festival 2012”
Reviews.Author: lg2bizzy4u
Reviews.Content: I stayed on this property during the Essence Festival 2012. The hotel was fairly nice. The staff that clean the rooms were great. The main thing that bother me was the paper thin walls. I precisely requested a room that was not near the elevator when I checked in with the reception because I read the reveiws about the noise level and sure enough I was put near the elevator. I did not get one night of sleep. If it was any way possible I would had went to another hotel to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Location Is What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Bella C
Reviews.Content: I have no clue where to start. Check in was somewhat smooth but we reserved a corner to find out that there was no corner room available. While speaking with young lady and look at map I explained to her that what she has provided was not what I asked for but instead of arguing about this I moved on to enjoy my vacation. Upon entering the hotel I went to charge my phone and none of the outlets on the lamps worked and only two plug ins worked in the room therefore we improvised by asking for several power strips in a room that we spent over $200 for. Paint on the wall chipped and ceiling area was cracked. Shower time and no towels after room was cleaned and after asking never received them therefore we used hand towels to make it through. The best people at this hotel was Dione and the two receptionist that worked in the restaurant and the managers of the restaurant could learn customer service skills from them. I was very disappointed with this hotel and the other major thing was no cookies which is there trademark.

Reviews.Title: “great location, better values.”
Reviews.Author: fatdrunkandstupid
Reviews.Content: this is a bland, outdated property. you could be in detroit as far as you know walking inside the hotel. the restaurant is below average as is the bar. the people are nice. if you can get a rate under $100 give it a shot. otherwise look around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with Some Design Flaws”
Reviews.Author: Christopher R
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Double Tree Canal Street for a weekend getaway with my wife in early July. The location is great for visiting the river front and the French Quarter. They allowed us a very early check in as we arrived at 10:30 am, and they were able to give us our room at that time. We found the bell staff very helpful. A lot of problems with the property are design issues with the hotel. The pool is tiny, not nearly large enough for a hotel of it's size. As other reviewers have said, the bathroom is tiny! The front entrance leaves VERY little room to even leave you car with the valet. I imagine at busy times you would be unable to pull your car into the entrance from the street due to the lack of space in the front entrance. Speaking of valet the charges are a lot, not unlike other New Orleans hotels, but it would be nice to have a self park option.

Reviews.Title: “DoubleTree is the place to be!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Nine
Reviews.Content: We (a group of ladies) celebrated my Mother's birthday in Nawlins and chose the DoubleTree as our home away from home. It was an excellent choice!!! From our arrival til our departure the stay was great!!! The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. If we called and requested new towels, a staff member would arrive at our door within minutes. The hotel staff always wore a smile and was willing to go beyond their duty to help. The room, the pool area...the entire hotel was immaculate! For my next trip to Nawlins, I will be staying at the DoubleTree!!!Â

Reviews.Title: “Within walking distance to French Quarters....”
Reviews.Author: pvsm123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 1 night at the Doubletree. The reception at the desk was very nice and respectful and check in was speedy. The room was comfortable and clean. The French Quarter was within walking distance, map available at the front desk... just ask. Received 2 free "continental breakfast" vouchers which we used. Would give them a try again...

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a "stay-cation"”
Reviews.Author: kretpa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are locals but decided to spend the weekend downtown and be tourists in our own city. We chose this property based on its ideal location near the Quarter and our loyalty to the Hilton brand. Upon arrival, the valet staff was very friendly and more than accomodating in assisting us with our luggage. Dee at the Front Desk was kind enough to allow us to check in before the 3pm check-in time and put us in a king room on a high floor with a great view of the city. The room itself was very clean and well appointed. We found the bed to be extremely comfortable and there was ample space in the room for the 2 of us. When we were headed out for dinner we noticed a manager in the lobby, Christy, who was helping guests with questions and she even offered to take a picture of my husband and I. I thought having someone in the lobby like this was a nice touch. We will certainly stay here again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great property that's convenient to everything downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Bad for the DoubleTree name”
Reviews.Author: JHazCLT
Reviews.Content: I normally love Double Tree properties. They are usually great and have wonderful staff... however, this Double Tree in New Orleans is a stain to the chain. I stayed here with my family last week, Sunday- Wednesday. The front desk staff is short, makes empty promises, and isn't helpful. When we checked in, we asked if there was a refrigerator in the room and was told that there wasn't (which was fine, we weren't expecting one), but the lady said that she'd have one sent up to our room for us. However, hours later, we still did not have one. We called and asked again, and she said that she was sending one up, and still we did not have one. My father had medication that needed to be kept cold. We had a cooler in case there was no refrigerator, but with the promise of one, we waited and waited. It would have just been nice to know that the front desk staff does NOT hold up to their promises in the first place so we wouldn't have waited. The next day, we still did not have a refrigerator and we asked again at the front desk and the same person told us that she was sending one up... and still no refrigerator for our whole stay. We asked THREE times. We also asked for extra towels several times and we never got them. We had to hang around until later in the morning and beg for them ourselves from the housekeeping staff. The trash can outside of our elevator was ROTTEN from the day we arrived. It would take your breath away. It was full of rotten trash/food. And was NOT changed the entire time of our 3 night/ 4 day stay. We asked for it to be changed, yet the housekeeping and cleaning staff walked by it several times that I saw. We also asked for a rollaway bed, which they quickly told us was against fire codes. There was so much extra room (the rooms are spacious) for a bed and would have been nice to have. They should make that known when you place a reservation for more than one or two people. The rooms are spacious, but dated. The restaurant in the hotel has terrible service. You have to beg to keep your drinks filled, the prices are high, and the portions are small ( for comparative pricing). The breakfast buffet was less than average and costed $42 for TWO people. Trying to get your car during a busy check out time is a headache. They are either slow to get your car or extremely rude. The person who was helping with valet had our car pulled up, but then couldn't find our keys. He was really rude to me about it-- like it was my problem. I understand that he was probably busy, but that is never reason to be rude to a paying customer. The valet costs about $35 after tax and there are no other parking options. This price is the highest I've ever seen valet in cities, and to be so high, you would expect SUPERB service.... but you get exactly opposite. The only highlight of this trip was the guy who loaded our bags while we were leaving. He was so nice. Unfortunately that did not make up for the bad, dishonest, unhelpful, and overpriced service for the rest of our stay. Double Tree should drop their name from this hotel QUICK. It is bad for their name and is not somewhere I would return to. It is in the hotel district, and there are several others that are closer and much nicer for comparable prices. The Westin is across the street and when I visited a friend inside--- seemed like a much better place. What a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ubergirl17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is precisely what you expect from DoubleTree, nothing more or less. My room could have used a fresh coat of paint but was otherwise fine. The staff was friendly and helpful. Stay here for the amazing location--you are within walking distance of the French Quarter, Convention Center, and countless phenomenal restaurants. Restaurant August and Mother's are both less than a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined Doubletree For Me”
Reviews.Author: colinaz
Reviews.Content: I had a tendency to prefer Doubletree properties prior to my stay at this particular one. I've had generally good experiences, even when the facilities themselves were below expectations. But this has changed my mind on them. In fact, I deliberately passed up a Doubletree for a trip I'm taking this coming weekend because of the experience here. What's been especially disappointing is the lack of a management response. I made three attempts to relay the issues I experienced during my stay, once through an email through Hilton's web site, once through the satisfaction survey that was sent out, and once in a phone conversation with the hotel's financial staff. I never received a response, so I have little recourse but to post an honest review. The first issue I had was actually contacting the hotel in the first place. The number displayed on the property's web site (and on TripAdvisor) leads to an automated answer with two options: "1" for reservations and "2" for all other calls. "2" takes you to a "The person is not available" message and immediately hangs up on you. "1" takes you to Doubletree's call center in the Philippines. I went that route twice in attempting to connect directly with the hotel. The first time, the agent was reluctant and somewhat argumentative, and I had to ask four times to be connected to the hotel. The second time, I relayed my issue and was cold transferred to the hotel's financial office (the agent never said "I'll transfer you"), resulting in an awkward connection. So this was all very frustrating. We had a reservation for six nights. Maybe I was supposed to slip the manager who checked me in a $20, but we got a room directly adjacent to the elevator block, which included the service elevator. Not only was it excessively noisy both during the night and in the morning, but it also resulted in no privacy from the one, small window, as it was on a corner and faced the public hallway by the elevators. I felt that we should have been given a room in a better location given the length of the stay. There were two maintenance issues with the room, one of which was the air-conditioner blowing constantly regardless of the temperature, resulting in a perpetually cold room. I complained twice about this and it was never fixed. I know they came at least once, because the other issue was resolved, but I never received any follow-up as to whether or not these issues were resolved or even looked at. I expected a quick phone call, at least, or even a note. We had a somewhat complex scenario where the reservation was to be in my name with me checking in, but on my wife's credit card with my wife checking out, with a bill in my wife's name. I felt that, as a business hotel, they should be able to handle this. I attempted to arrange this ahead of time with the management, and was able to check in. However, the evening before my wife checked out (June 6), she attempted to talk to the manager on duty and found her to be unhelpful and unwilling to deal with the situation. She returned the next day to find the same manager, and the same attitude. This resulted in me having to call the hotel and attempt to fix the problem myself after she checked out. As far as I'm concerned, I should not have had to call them. When I got on the elevator sometimes, I would press the floor, the door would close, but the car would not move. This happened to me four times, and I feel bad for anyone who's claustrophobic, as I'm sure this would be terrifying for them. The only way you could get it to move is by pressing the door open button, then the floor button again. Overall though, the room was clean, well laid out and the decor was modern and nice. The staff were generally nice, the lobby was very attractive and I enjoyed the cafe downstairs (although I didn't eat there). The location also is excellent. We had stayed at another hotel on Canal the previous year and had constant issues with street noise despite being on the top floor. Our room here was quiet, even though the pool was directly below us. However I would not stay here again and would discourage anyone from doing so. This is well below Doubletree standards and, for what you pay here, there are much, much better hotels in the CBD and even on Canal Street itself, including several Hilton family properties. It would be in anyone's best interest to go another route.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and the location is great I must say that. That being said , the rest of the hotel was not a good experience. The rooms are very noisy. You can here everything next door and in the halls. The bathrooms have no fans and steam up badly. Being the size of a closet doesn't help. The rooms are musty and damp all the time. We had to go out and buy Lysol spray to make the room smell good. The WOW Cafe service is terrible. Very slow to wait on you and once order is in the food takes forever to come out. Breakfast buffet is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: amigos123
Reviews.Content: After finding out that our reservation had been cancelled at another local hotel we came to the DoubleTree in hoping they would have a room on such short notice. The staff there is so nice and friendly! The rooms are nice, the complimentary cookies are so yummy, and its so close to Bourbon! This is were we will stay everytime we are in New Orleans! (A big thank you to the front desk clerk who took care of us this day when we thought our trip was ruined! You are a lifesaver and we thank you!)

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zyla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree for one night in early June.The rooms were modern, clean and large. The front desk staff was nice. The location is right across the street from Harrah's Casino(where I stayed until 6AM) and close to the French Quarter. You can walk since it is on Canal St. near Bourbon. I would stay there again for a short visit. We just prefer the Omni Royal Orleans Hotel where we moved to for 5 more nights because of the ambiance and location. We didn't use the pool or restaurant. We booked the John Besch Dining package and got the room for $111.00 a night plus a coupon for %20 off of a meal at any Besch restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff, clean room, good location”
Reviews.Author: JSS3
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay at this location in New Orleans, meeting friends for a special dinner. We usually stay at smaller venues on Chartre St., but this hotel is across the street from John Besh's August, and that was our prime reason for booking at DoubleTree. The front desk was excellent. Every single employee spoke to us and seemed to be glad we were there. Our room was nice and clean and the beds comfortable and all the amenities were there except my wife could not locate a hair drier, but she had brought her own. Women seem to be more interested in thread count of the linens, quality of the toiletries and number of pillows, while I am more interested in a clean quiet room, comfortable A/C, and Fox News Channel in HD.... I was satisfied. We were provided with a complimentary breakfast and were pleased with the hot array of choices and outstanding service. Digressing... the night before, we returned from supper at August and decided to have a drink before retiring. The waitstaff were all terrific.... gifting us with a taste of Abita Amber, a local beer. All in all, this is a nice place and a good location. The casino is across the street. So is August for fine dining and great meals at one of our favorites for over 40 years.... Mother's. Yes, there is valet parking. I don't like anyone driving my car besides me and my wife. But, I didn't want to park it on the street. I could see it from my window and it was secure. So, I must say we had a very good one night stay and can recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to visit the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: LantD
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel and staff was helpful and friendly. The valet parking was $30/night and that's cheaper than the public lots @ $40/night. The breakfast buffet was not worth the $17 per person charged but it is a Hilton hotel. Rooms were nice, had wifi and good view of downtown and the river. The bathrooms were tight. The Harrah's casino next door also made it nice.

Reviews.Title: “Valet was Expensive and Buffett Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: afmil03
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was outstanding. Great location around everything...especailly right next door to casino. The hotel only offers valet parking...its $30.00 plus tax...I only stayed one night and the valet after tax was $58.00....not counting the tips I gave to valet drivers...probably spent $70.00 all together for valet...for just 1 night... Thats where the hotel gets you. Anyway The buffett breakfast they offer in lobby had great choices...however just for myself the total charge was a little over 18.00 dollars..not counting the tip I left.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: arctush
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel looks ok, but the rooms are pretty run down and need renovation. Rooms are also quite small. We had booked for 5 nights and checked out after one night. Went for breakfast in the restaurant at the hotel and they had no spoons, we had to get plastic ones from the coffee place next door. The 5-6 staff in the restaurant could not cope with the handful of tables, so service was poor. The only good thing was the warm cookie at check in, that is why I did not rate it terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a remodel!”
Reviews.Author: 365travelNYC
Reviews.Content: Despite its high room rate, this property is need of a serious remodel. The bathrooms are larger than ones you would find on a plane, but not by much. You literally have to close the door everytime to find any room. The sink and counter are the perfect height for a small child, but not an adult. I'm not joking. Rates are much too high to be that far away from the convention center and Bourbon St. Average staff friendliness. The breakfast is not quite worth the charge. Some items were depleted and not restocked until asked. Many of the dishes were still wet, some with food particles. Literally had to pick up 3 plates to find one clean one. The self-serve coffee was luke warm. Did not get the sense that this area of the hotel was well managed or efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Needs complete overhaul”
Reviews.Author: parislover82
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend travels all around the world for business often- he's gone an average of almost 2 weeks every month, and he always stays with Hilton. So we decided to go to NO for a few days and stay with some earned points. We chose the Double Tree because of the location. Had I read the reviews of it before we booked, we would have stayed so somewhere else. I have to agree with all the posts I am seeing.....it's old. It's very musty and desperately needs updating. Its not very clean. The bathtub in our first room was stained and gross. The toilet was that of a public restroom- which I've never in my life seen. The room itself was tiny; paint and wallpaper were coming off and there was a hole no one had bothered repairing behind the door. We spoke to the front desk and were moved to the penthouse, as it was the only room available for the entire length of our stay. Once there, the pillows had a weird, stinky odor. And there were ants. We would take our shoes off and sit on the couch, and there would be ants crawling all over our shoes within minutes. The bathroom was cleaner but badly needed updating. Overall it wasn't as bad as the first room, but it wasn't good. The "Wow" bar downstairs isn't a bad little place to grab a beer, but who I'm guessing was the manager, made it unbearable. I didn't even make it through my first drink and had to leave. He was standing at the end of the bar trash talking everyone in there who was giving them business. From the ladies at the other end of the bar to the guys with a bachelor party grabbing a burger to his own cooks in the kitchen. It was ridiculous. We appreciate the staff trying to be accommodating by moving us to another room. But we've agreed that the next time we go back to NO, we will definitely be staying elsewhere. Just not up to par with what Hilton properties are usually like.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location”
Reviews.Author: Terry L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Located across the street from Harrah's Casino and about two blocks from the Riverwalk. The street car will pick you up just steps from the hotel on Canal Street. The hotel is a little older and the rooms are a little small. But most rooms in New Orleans are tiny. After all, who really spends that much time in their room in New Orleans?

Reviews.Title: “Just so so!”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Not as bad as I had thought it would be going by previous reviews It was friendly, clean, great location, small pool but O MY that bathroom was so small and very badly designed it was hard to close the door we had 5 nights to use it Breakfast was very poor same same each morning if it had a few people in the room service was terrible even though it was buffet it was nearly impossible to get tea/coffee & extra $$ for a very poor omellette was a no no But I would use it again as the location was great

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeasue
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October of 2011. It was very clean and nice but bathroom was a little small. The bellmen and entire staff were awesome and very helpful. It is in a great location walking distance of just about everything. We chose this hotel due to price and location. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located ..”
Reviews.Author: JAB611
Reviews.Content: ... between CBD (Central Business District), the French Quarter, and the Warehouse District! Walking distance to virtually all of must see and do's in Nawlins! (directly across the street from Harrah's Casino!) Competent staff and fairly clean hotel, by area standards, and room amentias were more than adequate. Hilton Honors members - the free "continental" breakfast left much to be desired (tip: opt for the bonus 1,000 Hilton pts instead!). Stay was during Jazz festival so the rack rate was a little steep for what you get, but location is prime.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all, but musty and dirty”
Reviews.Author: jac31072
Reviews.Content: We got stuck staying at the DT because the hotel where the wedding we are attending was booked for this one night. We checked in late and all went smooth. The lobby is drab, there is a restaurant called "Wow" on the first floor that tauts itself as a "wingery". We did not try it. Our room is on the 12th floor and was very quiet. However, when I scoured the room there was a disgusting hair on the toilet seat. We were too tired to care, so my husband wiped it off with a towel and some soap. The room is small. The carpet is filthy and we refuse to walk barefoot. The room also smelled very musty given the NO humidity. There's a nice view of the casino across the street, the shops at Canal Place, and the Riverwalk. The hotel has a pool, but we didn't use it. In a nutshell, we stayed here on points out of desperation and doubt we would stay again. Oh, and the beds are soft, so you kind of sink in. It wasn't very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: elarondy
Reviews.Content: Tired, poor service, close to nothing. Miserable bar, concierge useless. Sorry, can't think of anything good to say.

Reviews.Title: “Damp, musty rooms. Dirty carpeting.”
Reviews.Author: Lville3
Reviews.Content: We are Hhonors members, and stay at Hilton Brands everywhere we go. This hotel is not up to Hilton standards. We stayed here two nights. The first night, there was a very musty smell in the room and the A/C also did not work well --it was either freezing, or off and roasting. We moved for the second night, but that room that was even mustier! At breakfast each morning, we heard other guests complaining about musty rooms too. The carpeting and bedding felt damp in both rooms, and the carpeting was also dirty (white socks soon got quite dirty!), and had not been vacuumed. Gross! The bathtub did not drain properly in the second room. We could have asked for yet another room; but, why should we have to keep complaining to get a decent room? Guests want to enjoy their vacation without having to continually complain about poor rooms. We would guess that management already knew about the problems; they should do a better job cleaning, maintaining and updating the rooms; and, when a guest has a problem, they should move them to a better room, not the same type of room where they are likely to experience the same problems. It just seems that this hotel is old, the small rooms are damp and dirty, and it was not cheap either! If there are better rooms, the hotel did not see fit to move us to one. There are so many nice hotels in New Orleans; we will stay somewhere else next time!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: evilmosquito
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a mixed bag. Stayed here for a bachelor party during Jazz Fest. Pros: It's a 10 minute walk to the French Quarter, so you can get there quickly and when you're ready to leave the craziness, it's far enough away to get some quiet. It's 1 block from Harrah's Casino. They had free popcorn and lemonade in the lobby each day. Cons: It is dated and worn down. Not typical of the Hilton brand. Tip: If you don't want to pay the $30+/night parking rate to park at the Hotel, you can park at the Casino for free, so long as you play 30 minutes/day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: wanderingidiot
Reviews.Content: Spent a few nights here recently on business. There is a good coffee shop in the lobby, as well as a breakfast restaurant. The cold side of the breakfast buffet is included in the room charge, and there is a $5 upcharge to partake in the hot side of the breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, etc). The location is walking distance to the financial district as well as the French Quarter. Harrah's Casino is right across the street. The front desk staff are very attentive and take great care of the guests. This includes area information, hailing taxis, holding baggage, etc. On my last evening here, there was complimentary lemonade, pralines and beaded necklaces in the lobby for the guests. The room was spacious and clean. I noticed a water leak the first morning I was there and informed engineering, who immediately took care of the issue. The fitness center is on either the 2nd or 3rd floor - and is only accessible by the elevator bank on the LEFT (as you approach the elevators). The elevator bank on the RIGHT does not stop at that floor. I would stay again - great location, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: PHILLYFREAK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and close enough to everything yet far enough away for it to be somewhat quiet and safe. Parking like everywhere in New Orleans is terrible. $36 a day and you cannot get your car past 4pm. We decided to just walk everywhere instead of even trying to drive in the city. Hotel is directly accross from Harrahs Casino which is good and bad. It sucked me in a couple late nights / early mornings after drinking all day. I wouldnt hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything went right with this hotel - location, staff, beds”
Reviews.Author: alfredale
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 12:00PM and were greeted by a very friendly front desk person named Dwanda. Our room was ready for us and we went right up. The room is a basic room with two queen size beds. Everything was clean and the room and bathroom were of ample size. We requested a refrigerator when we check in and it was promptly brought up. The daily housekeeping staff promptly responded to our request for additional tea bags. Each time we passed the front desk and Dwanda was on duty she made us feel welcome in the hotel with her friendly manner. We would recommend this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: lagniappe13
Reviews.Content: Always a greeting from their staff, easy walk to French Quarter, Riverwalk and Central Business District. Rooms were nice with comfy beds and pillows - very clean! I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JeanneHouston_P
Reviews.Content: The staff at Doubletree was extremely cordial and very helpful. The concierge even took time to walk us to our streetcar location so we wouldn't get lost! The location is close to everything but the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but dated room size”
Reviews.Author: bumpkin13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree at the foot of Canal Street. Super location in that you are close to the French Quarter, Business District and 2 of the streetcar lines. Right across the street from the downtown mall, casino and aquarium. But the downside is the rooms are small by today's standards. I am a diamond Hilton member and still our Hilton Honors floor room was small. Bathroom door could not be closed if someone was using the toilet. And on top of that they wanted $249/night. Got to be better values in NOLA. We also ate the hotel's breakfast all three days of our visit. Go for the Continental breakfast. The hot buffet is not worth the extra $5. One day there was a large tour group in the hotel and it was like a tornado had hit the buffet! Nothing left but half cooked eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad!”
Reviews.Author: jilllynn1020
Reviews.Content: Room was small but in a great location! We spent 3 nights and 4 days and walked to the French Quarter every night without a problem. The bathroom was a little small and not a lot of water pressure but other than that everything was fine!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Norm for Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Atlanta-Folks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at Doubletree hotels quite frequently when we travel and this was our first time at the one in New Orleans. We were in town for a special event and chose this one for its location. When we arrived at the front desk we were told our room was not ready (which we expected since we were early) and we were told she would call once it became available. We (along with other guests) waited several minutes to check our luggage because the attendant was out in the lobby visiting with people. We went to lunch, walked around for awhile, then returned to the hotel. When we approached the desk and inquired about our room the front desk attendant rudely told us she had called to notify us. (There was no indication of this on either of our phones.) She was not friendly at any point during our check-in. When we got to our room we were surprised by the size of the bathroom. (I know this has been brought up by other guests but this is one of the smallest bathrooms I have ever seen that was not on a cruise ship.) The walls and doors are VERY thin and we were woken up several times during the night by guests talking and doors closing.The morning of check out, my husband called down 20 minutes before we planned to depart so our car would be ready. (We really weren't sure we needed to call ahead since it was 530 am, but after reading some of the reviews on this site we did so as a precaution.) When checking out the person at the front desk was much more pleasant than the person who greeted us upon arrival. This turned out the be the only postive thing I can say about our stay. When we went out to get in our car we were told that it was parked off site and they would need to go get it. Needless to say we were beyond frustrated. We waited 20 minutes for our car (there was only 1 other couple waiting on their car at this time.) We will not stay at this Doubletree in the future.

Reviews.Title: “not up to par”
Reviews.Author: bonefisherman1
Reviews.Content: Room is very small with the shortest sink I have ever seen. The carpets were not clean and the hotel itself was poorly run. The bar was uncomfortable. It was quite noisy. The only good points were that the beds were pretty comfortable. It is expensive to park there also and can take quite a long time for the valets to deliver your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelman360
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the rooms on the top floor. The service was great. We got in late and the bar was closing but the bar tender still sold us beer and it was just what we needed after a long trip. The room was very clean and comfortable. The location is perfect if you just want to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, outdated room, uneven service”
Reviews.Author: Fritch
Reviews.Content: This was a great location for walking to the Convention Center but then being able to walk to the French Quarters for dinner. The rooms are small and clean but a number of parts (shower, flooring) are quite dated. Thin walls can to tough if you have loud neighbors. Staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful but the wait staff at the restaurant was the worse that I have seen in a long time - impossible to get a second cup of coffee and they got easily frustrated when my co-workers would come down one by one and join our table. Pinkberry yogurt shop next to the hotel is excellent - didn't get a chance to try it until my last day - bummer. My co-workers were right - it is addictive, even in a great eating city like New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “"Not to Worry"”
Reviews.Author: ZekeZelenker
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews about the noise of this hotel, the paper thin walls and the bad service. I expected the worst, knowing I was coming at a very busy week for New Orleans. Here is what I have heard in the night. The sound of my neighbors door opening. Once. And once in the morning. The nerve of my neighbor to enter and exit his room using the door handle that makes a metallic click. That's it. Nothing from the hallway. Nothing from the adjoining rooms. Nothing from the street. As for the staff, the worst thing I can say is, upon arriving, I was not prepared for the friendly and animated personality that greeted me. It caught me by surprise and I had to rid myself of my grumpy, I-got-the-middle-seat mode. I'm so fond of that dark mood. But I had no choice. Her positivity was infectious. And Seth, the concierge, I asked for one simple suggestion for where I could get Jambalaya. Darned if I didn't walk away with a week full of recommendations for every kind of food at every price point. He even printed out menus for me. He said he was the Best Concierge in the World, and after meeting him, I believe it. The only place I might find agreement with the Naysayers. The rooms are small. Clean, well-furnished, comfy bed...but small. However, for me, it's New Orleans, and although I am not fully versed in all the municipal codes of this town, I am pretty sure it's a crime to stay in your room. So if this is where you choose to stay in New Orleans, rest assured, it's in a good location, the staff is superb, and you will get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: SouthwestTravelerPa
Reviews.Content: Two days prior to leaving on this trip I read several poor reviews about this property. So it was with some trepidation that I left on this trip. I am happy to say that my experience was the exact opposite of the reviews I had read. Yes, the lobby is somewhat small when compared to some place like The Roosevelt. However, I typically spend little time in the lobby, so that was not an issue for me. The property is clean & well-cared for. The staff I interfaced with was friendly & helpful. My room was clean, the bed comfortable. There were plenty of pillows. The sheets were clean & soft. The bathroom was small, but more importantly, it was very clean. I tend to judge a hotel by the cleanliness of the bathroom. The towels were large, fluffy, & clean. Yes, there was noise from the hallway on Friday & Saturday around 0330. That was caused by the drunken guests returning to their rooms. About the only thing I can say that needs repair was the bathroom fan; it did not work, which makes it no different than the bathroom fans in 95% of the other hotel rooms I have stayed in. I would certainly stay at this Doubletree again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Costumer Service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lakiel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Double Tree on March 16th â€“ 18th. Customer Service: The customer service was horrible the front desk clerks were rude and unprofessional. Customer service means a lot when you are a paying customer. Double Tree needs to improve their front desk staff. I would never stay here again. Location: The location of the hotel was great not far from Bourbon Street. Hotel: The hotel could use a complete makeover. Tours: Capital Trolley Tours is a must do! Our tour guide name was Norman, he took us all over New Orleans, and we had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nothing too special, average”
Reviews.Author: Meliss1056
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from March 21-24 and as the other reviewer stated, you can definitely check in early. That was nice, but it does mean that they aren't too busy. The room itself was spacious, and served the purpose well. I loved that you could get free water bottles at the front desk. That's a rare but nice treat at hotel these days. We stayed on the sixth floor, and unfortunately were placed right by the elevator. The bathroom was the strangest part of the room. There was a random countertop in a small space that had no sink inside of it. That random counter leads to a door to the bathroom where the vanity sink was EXTREMELY low. I am only 5 ft. tall and it was too low for me. I thought it might be a handicapped room, but there was so little space in that bathroom that it would be impossible to fit a wheelchair in. Brushing my teeth or washing my face in that sink was hard for me. I can't imagine what it was like for my 6ft tall husband. Do not ask the bell staff for recommendations on restaurants. They recommended a TERRIBLE restarunt nearby. After that, we relied on trip advisor ratings for all our selections. All in all, it get's the job done. Nothing too fancy, nothing too terrible. It's an average property.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: rc1mercado
Reviews.Content: Traveled to New Orleans for the St. Patrick's Day weekend and stay at the Doubletree. I do not have anything bad to say about this hotel and it's accommodations. My husband and I were assigned a room with 2 double beds. The beds were very comfortable. We had a flat screen television and modern furniture. As far as the restroom, it was a bit small but it had a full size bath and sink. I don't know about you but I do not travel to New Orleans to spend my time in the restroom. The hotel is walking distance from the French Quarters and of course, Bourbon Street. All in all, it was a place I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Xronos
Reviews.Content: Great service and cleanliness are the two most important aspects of a hotel stay for me, and this Doubletree far exceeded my expectations in both categories. I travel often for business purposes and I was pleasantly surprised with my stay at the Doubletree. The hotel was chosen for me since I was part of a meeting taking place at the hotel. After reading some reviews before departing for the trip, I was less than thrilled. I will say that I experienced none of the issues that other reviewers have detailed. From the front desk staff to the restaurant to house keeping, the service was top notch and excellent - I couldn't have asked for better. It is obvious that the management at the property is placing a heavy focus on customer service. The business office worked with me to find a great meeting room, the front desk was very helpful on several fronts - from helping me find places to eat, to switching my room quickly (the first one smelled like smoke), to bringing supplies up to our meeting room, they were fantastic. I was also impressed with the staff at the restaurants who were very attentive and remembered me when I revisited. As an aside, I would recommend trying the 'Maple Street' blend of coffee from PJ's at the hotel. I did speak with the front desk manager to compliment him on the level of service I was experiencing. He was very nice and let me know that they have made some changes in the last 60 days in order to turn things around at the property - in my opinion, their efforts are succeeding brilliantly. I never did experience any issues with noise at the hotel - the doors on my floor all closed slowly without slamming shut. The rooms are small BUT are immaculately clean and the beds are comfortable - I slept very well during my stay there. Additionally, the hotel is less than a 10 minute walk from Bourbon Street and a 10 minute walk in the other direction to the convention center. If you can handle a smallish room, then I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. You will receive great service from people who obviously enjoy what they are doing and make it their mission to ensure that their guests feel valued and well cared for.

Reviews.Title: “You can check in early....”
Reviews.Author: Gagal
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can really say about here is that you can check in early. Which means they are not busy. We were there during the SEC Men's Basketball and yet could check in before noon. To me that is not a good sign! The room was clean but they are like little boxes. I am a short person and the bathroom counter was too low for me! We only stayed here because we had a voucher and it was only for the one night.....YEAH! This hotel needs to be revamped soon.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry M
Reviews.Content: This place was ok at first, then it got worse and worse. We decided to go have breakfast downstairs in the lobby the first day. We got cereal, a banana, and begged a waitress for some coffee. Then as we were about to leave....bam got a $17 tab for the "breakfast bar." Completely agree with the review below me, walls are paper thin. You can hear a pin drop in the hallway and every door open and slam shut. Room service was ok, expensive though. Oh and if you don't ask for something when you order, you won't get it when you call back to ask for it...Ranch? In conclusion, the worst part of the trip was the VALET PARKING!!!! DOOOOOOO NOT GET YOUR CAR VALET PARKED HERE!!! I called promptly before I wanted to leave, they told me 20 min, so I headed down in 15 min just to be on time, no car after 30. Went to let them know, hey I'm here. Gave me another estimated 20 min. After an hour, no car. Went back again, said I now had 9 cars ahead of me. We are now 1 hour and 30 min in and still no car. Went back and was told, it just left the lot should be here soon. 2 hours, STILL NO CAR!!! Went back said your car has a flat tire and they are changing the tire, should be here real soon. 2 hours and 30 min later, STILL NO CAR. Went back said it just left the lot, WOW my car has left the lot 3 times but no where in sight? FINALLY my car pulls up and there is crap all over it, the guy said oh your car was parked in a construction zone so we had to wash it, was not wash well at all. The flat tire probably came from being parked in a construction zone!! Why would you park my car in a construction area 10 blocks away??? WILL NOT BE BACK TO THIS PLACE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't touch it with a barge-pole....”
Reviews.Author: PimlicoTram
Reviews.Content: Although convenient for the centre of town, this hotel is tired and in dire need of a complete refurb and/or the wrecking ball. The rooms were small and during my (truncated) two night stay, I had to call maintenance three times to fix plumbing problems (no hot water in the basin, toilet that wouldn't stop flushing and then water leaking from the pipework over the floor). Staff at front desk were friendly and doing a great job in difficult circumstances, but generally it was a losing battle. I regaled a colleague from Baton Rouge about my experience and he described it as the one hotel in the CBD he wouldn't consider staying in. Oh, and the rooms smell of wet dog. You should avoid this like the plague - you might assume from the above that this is a bargain basement hotel. It's not - I was paying $244 a night. In the end, I gave up and went to the Windsor Court next door, which was a vast improvement and cheaper. At least the Doubletree was decent enough to charge only half price in the light of the trouble I'd had. Hilton need to sort this out - big brand damage.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.....”
Reviews.Author: kbh2012
Reviews.Content: We had quite a few problems. First the rooms were inexpensive but I still expect some level of service from a Hilton Hotel The first room had pink and black mold, tv didnt work, ceiling had current water damage. They did however move us and the second room which was better, bathroom very small. The rest of the visit it was just small things, but I believe their motto is attention to detail...the detail was lacking. For example, missing soap, coffee, condiments, didn't recieve a wake up call as requested, and some other customer service items were very poor. The restaurant was even worse..the food and service were very bad. So bad that we didn't even use the free coupons for breakfast, and went elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Jackfishem
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the marathon. This hotel was right in the middle of all the action. We could walk to the convention center, the French quarter, and the start of the race. The hotel seemed a little understaffed with only one person at the front desk during check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Avoids this hotel at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: taylorry
Reviews.Content: Ifi had a choice of choosing anything less than a "1" for my review, I would have done so. Rooms are dirty and the staff is atrocious, that is including the front desk through housekeeping. There's is one exception and that would be for the night shift at the front desk, these individuals were actually pleasant and helpful, however it is not enough for me to return to this hotel, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Time to renovate”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler70
Reviews.Content: Location very good. Desk staff and concierge were very positive and helpful. Lobby is outdated and very small. Did not try either the restaurant or lounge; neither appeared that inviting. Room & bathroom was very small and both needed a do-over. Ventilation was poor - humidity was extreme and room seemed like a sauna at times. Mentioned this to the desk and their engineer's solution was to turn the temp. down to 60. Furniture was damaged (drawers broken). Wheels on desk chair were broken and height could not be adjusted. Why did we stay - inertia! Will we go back - no!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Not as Scary As the Posts Make It Sound”
Reviews.Author: agmsgm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during Mardi Gras. After reading the posts I was a bit afraid to stay here. This hotel is in the best location, walking distance to almost everything. The hotel itself could use some freshening up, but all and all not bad. The bathroom is extremely small, but not really a problem. It would help if they put fans in the bathroom so the mirror wouldn't fog up. The bed was very comfortable.I do agree that the walls are very thin, and you can hear whenever anyone walked down the hall. We had a problem with our tv remote, and they fixed it promptly. We found the front desk to be very helpful and they even suggested restaurants to try.

Reviews.Title: “Just o.k., but not by much”
Reviews.Author: numberoneGonzo
Reviews.Content: We used to live in New Orleans. We go back every year for Mardi Gras. That is the only reason we stay at this hotel and for the adjoining rooms. Otherwise we would not choose to stay here. It is on the parade route and is within walking distance to places we either need to be or want to go to. Although, you can get stuck at the hotel before and during parades. As in you may not leave with your car and only on foot. In addition you may not be able to get to the hotel before and during parades if you want to go back by car. The hotel is badly in need of a renovation. Attention to detail was lost. When you see caulking not trimmed back and the ceiling peeling you know it was done carelessly. The rooms are just ok. The toilets have an industrial lever and have a deafening flush. Unbelievably loud. The beds are decent. The breakfast buffet is nasty. All of it. I only felt safe to let everyone eat something that was in a box that they didn't make. We did not find the staff a problem, which is pretty remarkable because it was during Mardi Gras. It does take a minimum of 10 minutes to get your car. It is in a noisy area. You can hear things from the street and hear things through room walls and the halls. Other than location for the time of year when we go, I would not choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out for the price”
Reviews.Author: movinit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly worn out. The front desk service is great but the concierge appears to be bothered by requests and the restaurant (Wow) has extremely poor service. The price per night for this hotel was over $400 with tax (of course it was the weekend before Mardi Gras) but I would have thought that half of that would have been too much.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras 2012”
Reviews.Author: THYP77
Reviews.Content: This location is great....right in the mist of the parades and Fun! I would like to give a big Kudos to Kenneth and his staff for being so professional and willing to help when issuses came up with parking. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New Orelans and plan on staying here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Expecting better than we received!”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: First of all, my wife and I have stayed in several DoubleTrees in the U.S. and have enjoyed all of our stays before this one. We stayed in the New Orleans DoubleTree on Canal St and we were very disappointed. We were given an upgraded room because of my HHonors status, however, even though the room was large the furniture was very mismatched and old. The ceiling must have been the standard 8' high, but seemed to be lower which made us feel claustrophobic in the room. The bathroom was very small with one sink and a sink area that held only the few cosmetics my wife brought. The jacuzzi tub was hugh and took up 3/4 of the bathroom. There was no shower, except for a shower nozzle on the tub. And their were no instructions on how to use all of the knobs on the tub. It took me 10 minutes to figure out how to even turn on the water. The two doors to the bathroom were very worn and scraped and there was not even a latch to close them. I had prepurchased two breakfasts for $10 each and we were very disappointed to find out that the hotel doesn't even have its own restaurant, but has contracted it out to WOW Cafe & Wingery for all of its meals. The breakfast was only a buffet and the food was less than satisfactory. The containers holding the food were broken and the food looked and tasted as if it had been cooked the night before. On top of the somewhat expensive rate, there was an additional $30 parking fee. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Other than location Doubletree has little appeal”
Reviews.Author: TravelsALot205
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Diamond member who stays in Hilton properties across the country. The Doubletree New Orleans has to be one of the worst (even when compared to Hampton Inns and other lower level Hiltons brands). Rooms are cleaned MAYBE by late afternoon, no cups at all in the bathroom, bare-bones staffing at night, ice machines that were broken, vending machines that did not work...just to name a few of the issues. Check in time was 3 but my room wasn't ready till 4. The air condtioning/fan didn't work in my room and I had to stand in line for 20 minutes at the front desk to ask to be moved--all because no one would answer the phone when I called the operator or front desk. I contacted Hilton directly and never received a response--which seems to be right on par for this hotel. The location is great--but the hotel and service leave a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Doubltree New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: R&G-Opine
Reviews.Content: Like so many reviewers I was disappointed with the Doubletree New Orleans after a 3 day stay during a convention in February 2012. Not because of small rooms and bathrooms, they can't change that, it's how it was built. I can report a few of the shortcomings of this location: The shower on 15th floor was a nightmare. No pressure and the temperature kept changing from hot to cold to scalding hot. Front desk said they would look into it. 3 days no change. Staff was apathetic at their best moments, dismissive at their worst. Breakfast buffett was vacant of variety or quality. Example, Milk Choices: Whole or Chocolate nothing else. Another example: no cereal bowls at 8:00 am and it took 5 minutes for someone to find me one. Positives: Location and Pink Berry right outside front door. I honestly do not like writing a negative review, but how can a Doubletree be ranked this low in a city with so many choices? Usualy Doubltree locations rank amongst the best. They are much too complacent in New Orleans to win my business again, and I do over 100 nights in Hilton Properties every year.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place to crash”
Reviews.Author: weimowner1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are decent but could use some updating, mostly in the bathroom. Service is not great except for the bellhops. However, the location is great especially if you want to use the trolley to go to more than just the French Quarter. It's also a lot quieter than most French Quarter hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Where Do I Begin?”
Reviews.Author: taxman53
Reviews.Content: I am here right now. Been here for 15 hours and have a list of issues I can share. 1- Checked in, the young lady at the desk wrote the wrong room number on the key packet. Had to go back down. Honest mistake? OK, but then..... 2. Small room, and the bathroom... well I have seen hotel closets that are bigger. 3. No vent in bathroom, so after the shower the walls, counter, mirror and floor are covered with moisture. 4. The damp environment seals up the tissue box so you cant get any tissues out of it. 5. Mold around the top of the shower. 6. The shower curtain does not keep water inside the tub. It appears that there has been flooding before in my room that has extended underneath the door. 7. The room is so small that the desk I am sitting at right now barely has room for the chair between the desk and the bed. 8. No safe 9. Toilet handle is moody.... flushes only when you know the secret pattern. 10. The sign on the roof says that this is the "Doub__tree Hotel".... maybe I am not actually at a Doubletree... but they gave me a cookie so I guess I am. I may update this as I have three more nights here... but I needed to vent now!! Only redeeming characteristics? Close to the casino, aquarium, and easy French Quarter walk. Pray for me!

Reviews.Title: “First and Last Time”
Reviews.Author: sharepauper
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the canal street Doubletree because It was convenient for a conference I was attending. I usually stay at the Marriott, but I thought I would try it as my company was paying me to attend. No problems checking in, the room was away from the elevator and ice machine, so I anticipated a quiet stay. After entering my room, I took out my computer and attempted to get on the internet, to my surprise, this hotel does not offer free internet unless you are a hilton honors member, I thought free internet was pretty standard in the hotel industry, but apparently not at hilton properties. I broke down and paid the $9.95 they charge for 24 hours of internet access, I then logged on to the slowest internet connection I have ever been on in my life. How could anyone ever conduct business in this hotel ? I immediately went down to the lobby and complained, but little did I know the staff are experts in acting like this is the first time they had heard of such a thing. Thinking this was a temporary situation I went about my business. Unfortunately this was not a temporary issue, but instead was still ongoing when I checked out on Friday. Other points I would like to make are the mattresses are soft, expect to have back issues by day 2, and the bathrooms are so small they put the towel rack in the shower. they don't change sheets on you bed, but they do make the bed up. Positive items are the elevators worked great, and the location is good, just don't plan on sending any trip pictures over the internet during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bigdhuntfish
Reviews.Content: We went on anniversary get away with two other couples. We reserved three rooms with king sized beds. Two of us got what we requested; the other couple had to settle on two double beds. We went out for supper and then down to Bourbon Street. One of the couples decided to call it a night early and to their surprise when they walked back into their room, they found that someone had entered their room and gone through my friend's purse and stole her husband's iPhone. When they told the front desk about the incident, all they wanted to do was comp their valet. That's not all!!! The noise!!!! Every time someone in the hall opened their door, it sounded like someone was trying to open our door. When the shower was turned on, it sounded like someone was tearing down the wall. I will never again stay at the Doubletree by Hilton!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls, cramped bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: WxJester
Reviews.Content: So I am unfortunately still staying in the Doubletree on business, counting down the hours until tomorrow morning when I can get out of here. I had to stay at this hotel for a conference, and chose it over the Hilton because there was no additional charge quoted for using the fitness center. Be warned that the Doubletree's proximity to the convention center depends upon where in the center your meeting is located. If you're in any of the convention center rooms closest to the bridge, it's a little less than a mile walk, which can be rough with posters, etc., in the rain. The hotel looks nice but small on the inside... but once you get to the rooms, it's obvious that this place is here to serve a lot of the casino clientele. Upon check-in at the Doubletree they were nice enough to give me free internet as a Hilton HHonors Silver member. Of course, the speed is so slow and spotty throughout the room (even when staying still) that I'd be very upset if I was paying the $13/day our conference was originally quoted for internet access. The bathrooms are TINY - I'm not a large person, but at six months pregnant I find it difficult to maneuver in there (if the counter wasn't as low as it is I'd be unable to turn around with the door open). There are some tiles missing around the baseboards in the bathroom, and the daily housekeeping has been hit or miss. And the walls are PAPER THIN. For the second night in a row, I'm stuck listening to the amorous adventures of the fellow next door and his extremely loud, er, ladyfriend. I suppose I should be thankful that he's getting his evening call out of the way before 3 am this time. I guess it would be fine if I was here to gamble, drink, and have relatively easy access to whatever additional companionship I was able to scrounge up. If you actually are in New Orleans for business or with family, there are much better choices.

Reviews.Title: “No okay for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: SanBlasBobbie
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers (tiny bathroom, shabby interior) but would like to add that the Wi-Fi connection all over the hotel (public spaces as well as rooms) was extremely spotty and laggy, making work difficult, and there was no in-room safe for laptops and other devices.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to par...”
Reviews.Author: TNSweetpea
Reviews.Content: Not the usual Double Tree. Unfortunately, the hotel is lacking in may ways... 1. Room decor is outdated. A bit worn and abused but clean. Bathroom is very tiny - enough room for only one person. No full sized mirror - the only mirror in room is the small one in bathroom over sink. The only garbage can in our suite was the only one in the bathroom. No secondary door lock - only the one lock which could be opened from the outside with a card key. Only two glasses in suite - none in bathroom. Bed and linens were quite nice - comfortable. The same little piece of garbage sat outside our room for 4 days, not picked up until the latter part of day 4. 2. We were consistently shorted towels - we'd start off one day with four and then after cleaning our room, we'd end up with only 1 towel. We were woke up at 7 am one morning by room service - which we didn't order. When we looked out the peephole, we couldn't see the delivery person but could hear her. We refused and then called the front desk. Security was notified and they promptly called us back explaining that she had tried to deliver to the wrong room. 3. Staff was very nice, polite and very willing to assist. Yummy cookies when we arrived. I was upgraded to a Junior Suite for being a Hilton Honors Diamond member. The hotel was quiet. The location was perfect. Nice options for in-hotel eating - not fancy but good. Overall, I enjoyed my stay in NOLA - but I might try someplace else in regards to a hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating”
Reviews.Author: allovus
Reviews.Content: The location of the Doubletree is good, but the rooms need updating. The bathrooms are very small and we had very little water pressure in the shower. The parking is valet only and is $30 a day. They did let us leave our car there until 3 pm after we checked out which was nice since we had a few things we wanted to do. I rate a 2 only because the hotel is in need of a serious update.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: DSLA51
Reviews.Content: Had a nice stay here. First time I had stayed at this location; was a last minute reservation. Found the room to be very comfortable, the staff nice and the valet staff especially accommodating. It is just across the street from the casino, about two blocks from the Riverwalk and a short walk to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars is just right!”
Reviews.Author: susanlst
Reviews.Content: Checked into the Doubletree on a busy Friday afternoon, was greeted right away from a very pleasant valet, Glenn. He welcomed us and asked if we needed assistance with our bags and/vehicle. Only valet car service is available here. Nice attitude and very welcoming. We were greeted in the lobby with free coffee and bead necklaces, great welcome. Check in was easy and quick, plenty of staff on hand.
