We were recognized as HH members, asked for an upgrade, but only got complimentary water and warm chocolate chip cookies. Love those cookies! Room was nice and high, away from traffic noise, unfortunately we are right next to the service elevator (room 1128). Would have preferred a quieter location. Opened our door to a nicely appointed room, but very musty smelling. Room seems to be damp and odor is noticeable. No bathroom fan, can't help the musty smell issue. Linens are clean and new and nice. Towels are clean, large and nice - wish there had been one more large on in the room for two adults. I can't be the only woman who wants a towel for her hair?! Bathroom is ready for an update. Tub needs regrouting and resurfacing. Tired and tight is this bathroom. Carpets are clean in the room, outside hallway is badly stained and carpet has lots of ripples - possible trip hazzard after a night of too much party. Nice flat screen TV, great desk area - nice big flat surface. Comfy chair to curl up in and watch the Saints game.

Reviews.Title: “What's with the countertop height??”
Reviews.Author: hotelpro18411
Reviews.Content: First of all it is hard to find this hotel. It is not ON Canal street but kind of on a side road. We drove around the block twice (with one way streets) before we figured out where exactly we were going. Thankfully it was daylight when we got there! The bellmen and valet were extremely helpful offering suggestions and making conversation with us. Then we got to the front desk... can someone teach the staff to SMILE? They are in the hospitality business and they were not welcoming. The bellmen however made up for this. The room: ours was small but clean. The very odd thing was the height of the bathroom countertops. I'm a normal height for a female 5'5" and I had to stoop to reach the sink! My 6'2" husband however really struggled with it! We just joked about it but some people may have an issue with it! When the hotel gets renovated it really should be raised about 10 inches!! Great location right across from the casino and walking distance to just about everywhere in the Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel which leaves you feeling ripped off”
Reviews.Author: Milh0use
Reviews.Content: We stayed in three different hotels in our recent US trip, who'd have thought the worst would be the Hilton? And we paid Â£200 per night for the privilege. Firstly, the hotel charges $30 per night for parking. We saw some public car parks nearby offering overnight parking at $20 per night, but weren't confident that they were safe, so begrudgingly paid the $60 for two nights. Checkin was friendly and helpful, and it was nice to get a free cookie (the only thing you get for free in the hotel). The room was reasonably appointed, but no fridge or microwave. A flat screen TV was included, with good selection of channels. Pay per view movies and games were available for extra charges. The hotel has wi-fi, but unlike the other two hotels we stayed in, this one charges $10 a day to use it. This seems a bit shoddy for a hotel these days, and goes with the general theme of never missing an opportunity of slapping on extra charges. Breakfast is an optional, chargeable extra. No free coffee unlike other hotels. Even the vending machines charged an very expensive $2 for a small bottle of water. We found that the shower wouldn't supply hot water for more than one minute at a time, sometimes not at all. Worst of all, we noticed that one of the sheets had a stain which looked too fresh to have been through the laundry, begging the question of whether they had been changed prior to our checkin. They offered replacement sheets but they took half an hour to arrive. We were in a hurry to get to the airport on check out, but there was only one person working on the front desk when we were leaving, and they were too busy arguing with a customer about a disputed $90 sundry expense on their room booking to get round to us within 5 minutes of getting to the desk. The location was convenient, but it is unlikely we'd ever stay again.

Reviews.Title: “They're really trying....”
Reviews.Author: kqhouston
Reviews.Content: Really, they are trying. Friendly, accommodating staff, great location. But the test of a hotel for me is what the bathroom looks like AFTER you close the door.....yech. Disgusting. I KNOW it is a busy time, what with the Saints in the playoffs, the Bowl games, etc. but I am definitely happy I did not pay rack rate or even close. I will say that the people were great. We needed a crib, foam pillows, extra towels and an after-hours cleaning of our room and they were great. Just needed enough time between occupancies to really, really, really clean up before tossing another customer into the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location, but ask for rooms facing the casino”
Reviews.Author: lilypad78
Reviews.Content: Our first visit was earlier this year for a long weekend and for the location, the hotel is a good deal. We didn't stay here for the amenities, such as the pool, because we haven't been in New Orleans during the warm season, but we love the location of the hotel. It's within walking distance to Bourbon Street (10 minutes in one direction) and to the French Quarter (10 minutes in the other direction). The neighborhood is quiet and is close to corner stores for late night runs for water and juice (a necessity after a day of drinking in NOLA). The hotel is across the street from a pretty nice Harrah casino (better than Atlantic City, but not as flashy as Las Vegas), which has table games (blackjack, poker) and lots of slot machines. Perhaps more importantly, a Starbucks in the casino for the early morning coffee and a Fuddruckers with very tasty burgers for late night "snack". The first time we stayed at this hotel, we had a room facing the casino and the second time we stayed at this hotel, our room faced the back and it may be just room 410 that we were in, but it seems to me that the layout of the rooms make those rooms facing the casino to be larger. Also, and again it may be just room 410, but the back-facing room has got really loud pipes so that everytime someone take a shower or go to the bathroom in the rooms next door or above our room, we hear the water movements. We wished we had asked for another room during our stay this time. Also, whoever is in charge of cleaning the 4th floor rooms don't do a very good job of cleaning, because for 2 days in a row, our rooms failed to be cleaned. The first time, we arrived too late in our room to do anything about it (11 pm), but the second time, we told the concierge at 11 am that we needed a cleaning, but when we came back at 4 pm, our room was still not done. We called the front desk and they were responsive enough to send a cleaning lady over with fresh towels, but didn't tell the lady that we needed our room cleaned so she wasn't in a very good mood when we told her that we needed more than towels. She straightened our room but left some plastic garbage and tissue on our bathroom floor. Nonetheless, I would still recommend the hotel because of its location and value. It is a 3 star hotel, after all, so we keep that in mind when we think that service or amenities could be better.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great room!”
Reviews.Author: Makerofdreams
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by a very nice staff member. The hotel was clean and we had a wonderful room! Clean, not old looking as some reviews have stated. The room was spacious enough, though I'd have liked it a bit bigger. After signing in they handed us one of their wonderful Doubletree cookies, which we enjoyed and it must have only been out of the oven a few minutes. It was a quiet stay withouth noise from the hall. We'd go back..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, old but clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Texasronni
Reviews.Content: Front desk very helpfull, rooms comfy and clean not big, would stay again on my next trip. Cafe du Monde only a few blocks away. Harrah's casino right across street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: Salomon M
Reviews.Content: Ilike the location but the hotel looks old. The rooms have good space. The bathroom looks good. For the price is not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: ScottyG777
Reviews.Content: This was my first assignment in New Orleans and neither my wife or I had been there before, so we made a mini-vacation out of it. It was a great hotel for us, we stayed there for two nights and had nothing but good experiences. The room was on the smaller side, but you shouldn't be in your room if you're in New Orleans! Everything worked perfectly and it was a super nice room, design and materials-wise. The mini-fridge was nice as well. We had a nice view out of our room and the restaurant in the lobby was great. They also had Starbucks coffee which was nice for those of us that like a bold brew. The valet guys were all super nice as well. Overall it was a great experience and we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud”
Reviews.Author: bfgleason
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival my husband and I were very impressed with the hotel especially the location as we were there to attend a Monday Night Football Game. The room was large the bathroom fairly small but who cares really. When we went to watch some ESPN pre-game the remote control in our room would not work so the front desk quickly sent another but it didn't work either. You had to stand directly in front of the TV with the remote about a foot in front of the sensor for it to work. After a late night at the football game followed by a trip to Harrah's we go back to the room to go to bed. Here come the issues!! I could hear the person in the next room SNORING!! Then the next morning the two women in the room on the other side could be heard drying there hair and then talking over the blow dryer. lol.So even though the people were nice and the location was great, there are WAY to many other options in NOLA to do that again...

Reviews.Title: “HMMMMMM..... not too sure of a return visit”
Reviews.Author: ladybugtx76
Reviews.Content: Not our first visit to this property. Very disappointing on this visit. We'd like to suggest that they take some time to go through each room and check for things like working air conditioners, loose light plugs, working plumbing, etc...Also, leaving a guest's room open, once serviced, is not acceptable last time we checked. We visit New Orleans two to three times a year..... not too sure if we will retun to the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL...HOUSEKEEPING STINKS”
Reviews.Author: IM515
Reviews.Content: My family has been executive hilton honors members for years. I have stayed at many hilton hotels and this was the worst one. My family checked in to this hotel on November 19, 2011. As soon as we pulled into the valet lot we were greeted by a very nice bellhop. He was extra friendly with the kids and insisted that he took all of the luggage from the car. When we checked into the hotel, the front desk person was really friendly, she cracked some funny jokes and then gave us our double tree complimentary cookies. When we first got into our room we were met by a lightbulb with no cover. The bell hop unloaded our bags then left. We were only in the room for a quick minute then we left to explore the city. When we came back to the room around 10:00 P.M. we checked the room for cleanliness. We are extremely clean people, so when we ever we arrive at a hotel we check sheets and bathrooms. The bathroom was extremely clean but the bedding was terrible. In the first room there was makeup and hair on the sheets. When then immediately called the front desk. They said that they would send someone up to change the sheets. In about one minute someone came up and handed my mother the sheets. He said that no one would change the sheets so she needed to change them. She then asked why. The man said that that was the way it was then he left. In about thirty seconds someone called our room. They then asked if we wanted to switch to another room and we accepted. The second room we had was filled with hair. Almost instantly we called the front desk and we were moved again. In the third room we, as soon as we walked in the bed had a bug on it. It looked as though it may had been a bed bug. The housekeeper walked into the room and saw the bug. He then flicked the bug off the pillow and then denied ever seeing it. We then went to the front desk we were then offered another room. In the next room we walked into we were welcomed with blood stains. The man once again denied seeing the blood stains. I took a picture of the stains to show the front desk. In the fifth room we were in there was a giant booger on the pillow. Almost instantly the man ushered us into another room. In the sixth room we saw more hair on the bed. At around 12:00 A.M. another manager had taken over. She offered another room and decided to comp our room. This last room was clean and spotless. I do not recommend staying at this hotel. On the room key it says to rest easy. This stay was just the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janaanmn
Reviews.Content: I struggle with hotel selection and had a really hard time finding a place to stay in New Orleans. I chose this hotel because of the chain's reputation and the location was good. The price was OK. The room was basic, some mold in the bathroom and rust on the celing, not super clean. The beds were comfortable. They should think about cleaning their carpet - really! Staff was friendly but isn't everyone in New Orleans? I wouldn't choose this hotel again, I'd look for one of the boutique hotels in the french quarter if possible or maybe the Marriott acoss the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view, location and room + Hilton Honors benefits”
Reviews.Author: FastTripper
Reviews.Content: I arrived around 5:00 pm and asked if there were any free upgrades available. The clerk must have noticed that I was a Hilton Honor member because he said he could upgrade me to a view room. I was pleasantly surprised to enter this large room on one of the top Hilton Honors levels with a great view of the Mississippi River. I had two nicely made-up double beds. The bathroom was not large but was clean. No free mouthwash, but I called the front desk and they sent me up two small bottles as I did not travel with any due to the carry on liquid restrictions. I tried out the Wolfgang individual coffee maker which made a nice cup of coffee. TV was flat panel but channels were not HD. The clock was the correct time, and when the time changed from daylight savings to standard during my stay, they not only put a reminder card on the bed, but they changed the time for me. No free breakfast, but the Harrah's Casino is immediately accross the street and they have a huge breakfast / lunch buffet for only $11.99. The conscierge was very friendly and remembered my name. I didn't have to order anything from him, but I did give him a nice tip at the end for holding my bag. I received a free fresh chocolate cookie on check-in. I asked for one on another night and received another. Elevators were fast. Front desk staff very friendly. The location is just a short walk to the Riverwalk waterfront mall - which is huge with a great food fair. There is also a high end (Sak's 5th Ave) shopping center kitty corner. The very tourist oriented French Quarter waterfront walk is also just across the street, and the entire French Quarter including the lively Bourbon Street is within very close walking distance. The location of the hotel could not be better. HIghly recommended for comfort, convenience, service and location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good service. Nice Value.”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Doubletree New Orleans. About what you would expect from a Doubletree. This hotel was very consistent in maintaining the standards of the brand. The location is excellent. Right next to the Casino. Close to the Riverwalk and Decatur Street. On the boarder of the French Quarter. The service was better than most chain hotels. The staff was very helpful. When we asked for recommendations of things to do, they did a great job of engaging us to find out what we wanted. Very attentive to our needs. The value was good for the quality received.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: athena381
Reviews.Content: Great location...right across from Harrahs and within walking distance to anything else. This is a typical DoubleTree with the great warm chocolate chip cookies. The rooms were an adequate size except for maybe the bathroom. The bathroom was a little tight for me and I am a small person. The staff was very friendly and the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: tech789
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located close to the French Quarter. The staff were great - very helpful and the units were clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Big80s
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for several visits to New Orleans. I have always found it to be a quality establishment. The rooms have always been clean and functional. I have also eaten at the restaurant on several occasions, and I find the food there to be pretty good as well. I have no complaints with this hotel, and would stay there again, and would recommend it to friends or others traveling to New Orleans. It is right across the street from Harrah's New Orleans, and a short walk to the French Quarter along Canal Street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Monty_RTA
Reviews.Content: Location was good (near the french quarter, riverfront and other good spots). The room had a nice bathroom. The room was clean. The only two bad things were no free internet (in the room) and the room temp was hard to control. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: WearyTraveler387
Reviews.Content: Being a long-time fan of the Hilton hotel family, I was looking forward to our recent business stay at the Doubletree in New Orleans. Unfortunately, I was sorely disappointed in the accommodations. Our various experience with the front desk staff, whether upon check-in or asking for recommendations or assistance, where underwhelming at best and bordering on rude. As many others have mentioned, the rooms were clean but dated and the bathrooms were tiny. Worse yet was the noise factor, even with earplugs. I could hear every conversation in our neighbor's room, every sound emitted from the bathroom, and even checked my room door on a few occasions because the sound of doors opening and closing was so loud it sounded like someone was walking into our room. Street noise was bad on weekends (from honking and revelers), but "milder" on the weekdays. The best thing about this hotel is its location-its proximity to sights and bars helped ensure I was tired and inebriated enough to get some sleep. But even at that, I was relieved to get home and sleep for more than 4 consecutive hours/night. For $180+/night I expected more for the experience. Next time we're in NOLA I'll choose a place that offers real value, rather than merely piggybacking off the Hilton brand.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but fine accommodation”
Reviews.Author: MorrisEdward
Reviews.Content: Well located between the arts district and the French Quarter and right next door to Harrahs Casino and the riverside walk. 15 mins walk to the convention centre. Very agreeable staff. Everyone gets a warm cookie on arrival these days. Free internet in the rooms once you know the free password. Limited free TV. Good sized beds. No safe or fridge. Two large double beds in 813. Rooms showing signs of wear. My loo roll holder kept falling off all week. Told staff on exit to be sure to fix it. Housekeeping very keen to provide new towels when old ones would have been ok. Forgot to replace coffee cups a couple of times - free coffee in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean. Good location”
Reviews.Author: budagirl66
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near the convention center, river front & Bourbon St (approx 6 blocks). It is also directly across from Harrahs Casino. The room was very clean and decorated well. We could hear the people talking in the next room when in the bathroom but it was faint. Room service was quick. Just had a sandwich for $16 but the convenience was worth it. We at breakfast at the hotel once. Seemed a bit pricy. There is a restaurant called the Red Slipper (I think) just a few blocks away. Great food & atmosphere. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but generally clean and good location.”
Reviews.Author: lovescabs
Reviews.Content: This is an older property, and seems tired. I can't put my finger on why. My room was generally clean, the bedding was fresh and furnishings were in good repair, but the walls seemed to have a centuries worth of paint. The view was terrible--I looked out at a side street and parking lot. As a Hilton Honors member with a fairly high standing, I expected a better view. I also was assigned a room with two queens instead of the king I had booked. The staff were generally pleasant, although some seemed more interested in flirting with each other than assisting guests. I had a terrible experience in the restaurant at breakfast my last day there, the manager comped the check as a result. The room was fairly small (if I had the king I reserved I would have had a bit more space, grrr...) with two two queens, a nightstand, desk, flatscreen TV. A small table held a coffee maker. No minifridge, which is something I expect in a hotel room these days. A huge gripe--the outlets built into the lamps (the only ones readily accessible in the room) don't accomodate a standard cell phone charger. The bathroom was sufficient but could have used better lighting and a makeup mirror. Not sure why hotels don't provide these small things to better accomodate the growing number of female business travelers... The towels were standard, amenities were nothing special. Iron and board in closet, but have fun trying to figure out where to set it up with enough light to actually see what you are doing and an available outlet nearby--I ultimately stuck it half in and half out of the bathroom. I didn't get my paper one morning. And check your bill closely, I was double charged for the Internet I should have gotten for free to begin with. And why on earth do they put nuts in their cookies, considering that 10% of Americans have nut allergies? The location was great, walking distance to just about everything and cabs readily available. Would I go back? Probably not. There are so many other choices in that area that I wouldn't settle for this one in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Old, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: joelandcc97
Reviews.Content: Room was okay. The website says the entire hotel is smoke free, but clearly our room used to be a smoking room. It smelled horrible. The paint outside the door was scratched up like somebody tried to break in. Pillow were too soft. Even with two my head was still flat on the mattress. I think the bathroom was designed for a little person. I'm 5'3" and the counter hit me mid-thigh. I had to duck in the shower to wash my hair. On the upside, the TV was huge!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: YogaTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Double Tree New Orleans prior to embarking on a cruise. The price was great at about $100. The location is nice, as it is across from Harrah's Casino and within walking distance of the quarter. A mall is also across the street. The staff was helpful, albeit young, but I had issues with my room key and they were quick to apologize and fix it. The lobby area is very clean, but the rooms were the cause for me rating this property "Average". I realize it is an older hotel, and I try to find the positive in everything, but I have to say the room disappointed me. It seemed as though the carpets and walls hadn't been cleaned in quite some time and it felt kind of dirty. The bedding was comfortable and there was great lighting in the room! We were on the 5th floor and our room looked right into an apartment complex, so we had to be extra cautious with the curtains. All in all, it was fine for the price but I would go to a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: tjbama
Reviews.Content: Headed down for a weekend with family and stayed here to be with everyone else. The staff was awesome and called the room to make sure everything was good after we were in it. We chose not to park the car here at 33 per day and used the Harrahs parking where its free if you play 30 mins per day using a total rewards card and swipe the machine in the casino. You have to leave and repark in the deck every 24 hrs but its FREE and just a few blocks away. The hotel is perfectly located across the street from Harrahs and the Riverwalk area. The rooms have updated decor, spotless clean and ultra luxurious bedding. We found the bathroom a little small and the counter was really low and no vent fan so you cannot see anything in the mirror after a shower. On the upside - plenty of nice hot water and great pressure! The wifi worked well, 4th floor pool was nice and really enjoyed breakfast at the restaurant (buffet). I agree that the walls are thin and you hear some noises but if you have a tv on, you really don't hear it so its not as bad as some have posted. The only thing I would have liked is a small fridge in the room. All in all, its a great hotel and we really enjoyed our stay and will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jamesteroh
Reviews.Content: I go to New Orleans every labor day and this was my first experience staying at the property. The hotel is a good value for the rate. I received an upgrade with no problem. The free breakfast for hilton elites is a full buffet. Asked for an extended checkout and was given a 2 p.m. late checkout with no problem. The elevators are fast. I stayed during Hurricane Lee and there was a letter under our door stating that due to Hurricane Lee some of their staff couldn't make it in and they were suspending housekeeping, but housekeeping was still offered every day during out stay. Staff was great and the location is good. It's right across the street from Harrahs and a very easy walk to the french quarter. As other posters have stated the bathrooms are small. My biggest complaint was the slow internet. It was so slow at times, it seemed like I was using dial up. On a posiitive note, the free wifi code works on multiple devices instead of being limited to one device, so my friend and I were both able to be on our computers at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “How can this keep the Doubletree name? The quality just isn't there.”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: While the front desk staff was friendly, but overall experience was poor. - WiFi in hotel was so slow I couldn't even keep the connection on. - The hotel sent the housekeeping staff away for Tropical Storm Lee...which was just on and off light rain. Every other hotel in the area had full housekeeping. They didn't make the beds, change the towels, or even take out the trash for 3 days. - No amenities for being a Diamond preferred guest...no upgrade, no bottled water, etc. - The walls are paper thin. I could hear the elevator door open (the bell chime) even being about 10 rooms away from the elevators. - The bathroom is tiny...can't get any smaller. - TV picture quality was not great (I didn't watch much TV). Pay a few extra bucks and stay at any of the much better hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: BigBadVoodooDaddy398
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree in N.O. from Aug 13-16 of 2011. Prior to that I had read some of the online reviews regarding this hotel. Here is my take on this hotel. There are pros and cons to this hotel. The pros are the location, the price for the value, and the service. The cons are the washroom size, and the valet parking. My wife, daughter, and myself plus my sister in law shared a room with two double beds. We had enough space in the room for us, plus our daughters "pack-n-play" (portable crib for those who don't know). Was the room large...nope. Was it small...nope. Was it adequate...you bet. Beds were comfortable. We could move around. Nice view of the river and casino. It's a typical hotel room in my opinion. Let's get to the cons. Every review on here has stated that the bathroom size is small. I can attest to that. They are small. But then how much time are you spending in the bathroom. I am 6'4" and was able to shower, shave, clean up, and "go potty" as my little girl says. So don't worry much about this. But it is a con if you are looking for a more spacious bathroom. The other con was the valet parking. $30 per night. Not cheap. And the closest public parking is not that close either. I had intended to use public parking (or hoped). I even asked when I pulled up where it was. The valet wasn't too helpful. Which I expected because otherwise how does he get paid? They were attentive though if you used the service. And you can get your car whenever you needed it....quickly. And it is secure. But still...the price is steep in my opinion and the hotel would be wise to let patrons know what other options are available. The pros. The first and most important pro for me was the service. Nothing short of excellent. The staff was attentive, friendly, quick. If we had an issue, they resolved it. If we had a comment, it was gladly accepted. They smile and say hello and goodbye. They offer suggestions when you need it. Couldn't have asked for a better group of people. If I worked for Doubletree, I would use them as an example of how to treat guests. 2nd pro (always an important one) was the price. Great value! It's not cheap by other "motel" standards. Remember you are right downtown. But given the location and ammenities, the price was right. 3rd pro is the location. When you can walk out of the hotel and cross the street to the french quarter...well it doesn't get better than that. We toured the french quarter on foot, as well as jumped on a street car to head to other areas of the city. Street car stops are right in front of the hotel. And if you want to gamble, Harrah's is right across the street as well. Anyway...there you have my review. Take it for what it's worth. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jgonzo23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel and although the decor is a bit dated, the staff does a nice job of maintaining its overall appearance. The hotel has a great location. Its a few blocks from all the major tourist attractions, trolly stops and very yummy restaurants. As far as the rooms are concerned, the living space is very spacious. The bathroom is a bit cramp but manageable. Everything seemed cleaned and in order when we arrived. Note, the hotel charges $30/night to park your car. There are 2 city parking lots across the street to the hotel which MIGHT offer better rates. Might be worth looking into. Enjoy! we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, AWFUL rooms”
Reviews.Author: 1njen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for just one night to enjoy some crazy fun on Bourbon St. For our anniversary. We've always stayed at Doubletree hotels in other states so we picked this one based on their pretty solid reputation. We used their valet which is $30 per night. The valet guys were friendly and helpful & really mde an effort to engage us in conversation. Check in was easy, we arrived 3 hrs before check in time and were able to check our baggage while we walked around waiting for the room to be ready. My husband had requested a room with a river view & the lady winked & said I'll try. We were called 30 minutes later, room was ready. The room was clean and either we were lucky to have gotten an upgraded room or they have upgraded them all since prior reviews. The bed was a king and the furniture was new & nice. It was small but in New Orleans who stays in their room all day/night? The TV was a large flat screen and worked well. The a/c was efficient and kept the room nice & cool. The room was said to be no smoking but the smell was there. So we checked for bedbugs (I hope everyone does this!!) found all to be ok, dropped our bags and off we went to find lunch. We cme back at 4pm to nap before our evening outings . We were almost asleep and WHOOOOSHHH,Bang,clack, WHoooosh. Neighbor has flushed the toilet. It was an enormous noise that scared the stew out of us. Then we realized that we could hear every single word the people next to us and across from us spoke. Yes, even the people across the hall because there's about an inch of space under each door and every sound, even a whisper travels right into the rooms. They weren't yelling or being obnoxious there is just NO sound proofing around the doors or between walls. It literally sounds as if someone is in the room with you. We did the best we could and had a great time out. The a/c was wet and moldy and caused the whole room and linens to be damp. We were out late & up early but sleep is impossible past 6am because of the extreme noise situation. My suggestion would be to try hard not to get a room that has an adjacent room with the metal doors and attempt to get away from the elevator or get a corner room and try for a floor that isn't occupied heavily. We had a good time but will not stay there again. It's just too poorly built. The staff was kind and we didn't complain about the noise because it's not their fault.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer H
Reviews.Content: I was beyond impressed with this hotel. We were in town for a Disabled Veterans Convention and brought along our children. The guys with valet were absolutely great. Our bags were unloaded and brought up to our room. Not only did the gentleman set up our bags for us but he also went down and got us ice. The whole 5 days we were there we were greeted and called by name. The guys there were great about suggesting places to eat and things to do. We truly enjoyed our stay and will most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cookies were the best part.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaNLCH
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very over priced, probably because of the good location. The rooms and style is quite dated but the beds are good and we slept well. We also had a nice view of the river. When we called for extra towels, they arrived within 5 minutes. vVlet parking was also always right on time. But it is ridiculous to have to pay 30$/night for parking when you are already paying so much. We actually got a deal from the hotel's website that promised valet parking for 20$/night but upon check out the bill said 30$. We asked about it and she changed it without a word...very strange. Concierge was very nice and helpful. Cookies were delicous, we asked for them several times during our stay and received them without complaint but never with a smile, as was the service in this hotel all the time. Pool is nice and spacious. Business Centre was convenient to print out some things and check email, but really wifi should be included in this kind of price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kaymarie24
Reviews.Content: Great location. Walking distance to Harrah's, aquarium, RiverWalk, great restaurants, etc. Our king room was very nice, comfortable bed. Bathroom very small but clean and efficient. Rooms are NOT soundproof. We could hear other guests down the hall and doors closing. Staff was friendly and efficient. All in all, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: mkb6896
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Doubletree before we were expecting much more. This is a much older building in serious need of updating. The walls are paper thin and the bathrooms are tiny. We didn't receive our cookies upon check in and later had to ask for them. The room and bathroom were both very clean with no problems there. The remote didn't work but was quickly replaced when we called. Sorry to say i got no sleep at all the one night we stayed. There were people laughing and yelling in the hall, doors were opening and closing (which is EXTREMELY LOUD, and someone decided they needed to fill up their cooler at 2am at the ice machine next to our room. Everything finally calmed down at 4am and i was able to get 2hours of sleep :( I know this is new orleans but good grief. Try and put families with kids on a seperate floor from those without. I hated that my son had to hear all the partying going on. Save that for Bourbon street. The pool was great and the breakfast, ordered off the menu, was EXCELLENT! The server was very nice and helpful. Loved that it was walking distance to everything we wanted to do. Will definitely stay elsewhere next time unless offered a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Party hearty. Sleep when you're dead?”
Reviews.Author: radguy79
Reviews.Content: I had several days of work scheduled in the French Quarter and wanted a hotel that was close, within the budget, and would also allow me to do some of the usual touristy things about town. I did have work to do on Sunday and needed to get an early start. First, PARKING. If you have car, parking in the area is atrocious. The hotel has VALET ONLY and it's $30 per night. The desk agent and valet guys recommended parking at Harrah's or the Shops at Canal. If you gamble for 30 consecutive minutes and you have a player's card at Harrah's, you get your parking validated. I was in the casino for over an hour and somehow only registered 15 minutes of playing time. I will not tell you how much money I lost. I gave up on getting my parking validated and decided I'd pay my way out. The casino parking also charges $30 and they only accept cash. I attempted to find parking on the street with no luck and resorted back to the hotel valet. The front desk staff and everyone else that I encountered was great. They were very hospitable and welcoming. The agent at the desk offered me several cookies, even though I clearly didn't need them. The room was very small. The bathroom was even smaller. I had a hard time getting my suit case in the door. The walls were thin and allowed for a lot of noise to penetrate the room. The air conditioner was noisy and rattled the ceiling tiles all night. There were also people milling around in the hallway ALL night. Once I got to sleep it wasn't an issue, but it took me a while to get there. I had a complimentary breakfast coupon which usually entitles you to a free breakfast buffet at the Doubletree. At this location, it entitled me to a free cold breakfast. Not sure what that's all about, but this property seems to nickel and dime you. I determined that this hotel wasn't right for me. I canceled my reservations for the next three nights and moved to the Doubletree by the airport. There's free parking, peace and quiet, and more room there. The Doubletree on Canal is definitely convenient if you're heading to NOLA to party hearty and you'll sleep when you're dead (I heard someone say that in the hallway.) If you're in town for other reasons and have a car, pick a place outside of the Quarter. Lady: "It's late. I'm kinda tired." Guy: "Yeah, sleep when you're dead."

Reviews.Title: “A very nice comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: CurvyDivaLady
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were smaller than I expected. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Just steps away from the casino and a great mall is across the street. Good location. Required Valet parking can be tedious when the hotel is full. And yes there is an extra charge as with most if the hotels there. If want some type of view pick a higher floor. Overall, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee_Hotel
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, even though they lost my reservation. The location was nice (end of Canal Street), and the view from our room was pretty good. Unfortunately that is the only good things I have to say. The valet was slow, concierge didn't know the area at all, and the cell phone reception was horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: merechat
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree has some of the most pleasant staff I've come across in recent times. From the bellmen to the check-in staff and then housekeeping. Everyone was happy, helpful and friendly. Reflects well on the management. Our room was a little small, but comfortable. The sheets were soft and silky and the bed comfortable. We enjoyed our stay here. At our summer special rate of 79.00 per night, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We are going back”
Reviews.Author: mikega
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Double Tree for five night and the location is perfect. Across from the casino, and one block from Riverplace mall. The Spanish Square and fountain are right next to the mall. Trolly goes right in front of the hotel, so you can ride to the garden district, etc. The rooms are small. I've stayed there three times now, but clean and the staff is good. I'll be going back this Sept. for four nights. I'll visit the french quarter which is real close. Both my wife and myself like the area and this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieP-9352
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip with another couple to New Orleans. We booked a room at the Double Tree, across from Harrah's. The hotel was neat and clean but the room was small and noisy. Anytime someone would enter their room nearby it sounded like they were coming into our room. I actually sat up a couple times to see if they were entering our room!! Had a tough time getting to sleep because of the slamming doors. Was woke up the next morning to people talking in the hallway. Could make out everything they were saying. Mentioned this to the staff as we were checking out and they commented that it was an older building. Other than the noise and small room, the beds were comfortable and the location was nice. Parking is pricey (30.00) per night so we chose to park at Harrah's where you get 24 hours parking free with 30 minutes play at the casino. We were staying 2 days so we simply moved the car once and ended up saving 60.00 by getting free parking (we were planning to spend some time in the casino anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price tag”
Reviews.Author: Abc123XYZ3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Doubltree on a recent trip to New Orleans. As other reviewers here have commented, this Doubletree is not up to the typical Doubletree standard, especially given the price. The hotel's rooms, lobby and common areas are in need of renovation. Our hotel room was small and the bathroom particularly cramped. Also as others have commented, the walls are paper thin and noise travels easily. The breakfast buffet selection is average. To their credit, the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. Overall, however, this hotel does not impress.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: Vsaunt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while at a 3 day convention. As others have mentioned, this hotel is a little worn out. There were scuff marks on the walls and the furniture was a bit shabby. A new coat of paint would work wonders. However, it was clean, the beds were comfortable, and it was not noisy even though we were quite close to the ice machine. The location is absolutely wonderful. It is within walking distance of the French Quarter, the River, museums, restaurants, numerous gift shops and the convention center. It is also right across the street from a casino and a shopping mall, if you're into that. Parking was expensive @ $30 a day. They have a business center on the 2nd floor where you can check your email and print for free. The check-in staff was okay, but the guys at the concierge desk were absolutely wonderful. I wanted to do some sightseeing in addition to my work activities and they were friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and there was ALWAYS someone there to help you with bags, directions, advice about the city, parking, and to give you an extra cookie :) If you're wealthy and used to the best of everything, this hotel is not for you. If you're the average Joe looking for a comfortable place to stay while enjoying the city, it will do quite nicely.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: dcollins0812
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Double Tree Hotel in New Orleans was a pleasurable one. I will definitely stay at the Double Tree Downtown hotel when visiting the Big Easy and, will recommend it to all my friends and family. The location is perfect and the cookies were delicious. Thanks Double Tree for making my stay a memorable one!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a realxing stay”
Reviews.Author: iamsid
Reviews.Content: I stay here couple of times. As I was there for business trip every time it is really advantageous that the hotel is very near to the airport. Overall a nice & pleasant stay every time. Havenâ€™t spent much time there but it was a nice stay altogether. If you are fond of shopping, one can find different shopping places at a walking distance from the hotel like Walmart, Best Buy & many more. For business trip it is a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms, staff could be friendlier”
Reviews.Author: dreese1
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a conference. Room was small (I guess not a surprise for downtown New Orleans) as was the bathroom. Old style TV. Rooms were not terribly quiet but the beds were comfortable. Nice but small exercise room with new equipment. Staff at check in was OK; however, at checkout I had to have the bill corrected and she was rude when I informed her the bill was incorrect. Not up to what I have usually experienced at DoubleTree properties. Location was good. 5 minute walk to the French Quarter and close to the Convention Center. Pretty good breakfast buffet (extra cost). Valet parking (we were told we could not self park) was expensive @ $30 plus taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: STLAnnie
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree Hotel on Canal Street is very centrally located and quite within walking distance of the French Quarter, the Market and the warehouse district. Our room was clean and quite large. It had a 32" flat screen and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was a little cramped, but everything worked just fine. We were in a corner room next to the service elevators, but never heard them. The window was small, but we had a partial view of the river and the pool. The pool was never busy. The breakfast buffet was very good with a good selection. The service in the restaurant was excellent. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. There is a yogurt place right out front that is a great way to cool off in the NOLA heat. Parking at this hotel is $30/day for valet. We, however, do not rent cars in New Orleans, because it is an easy town to walk around, take a streetcar, or just hop in a cab. You can get a cab from the airport to anywhere in the CBD (downtown) for only $33 (for 2). For 3 or more in the car - the price goes to $14/person.. I'd recommend a cab to get downtown the quickest. It is about 20 minutes to downtown from the airport - at light traffic times. Harrah's Casino is located right next door.

Reviews.Title: “beware of prepaid rooms”
Reviews.Author: king7981
Reviews.Content: we prepaid our rooms in january for may wedding.this deal was for no refunds or exchanges. we saved twenty dollars a night for this deal.i took ill that month with a infection in my jaw bone which reqired a root canal and antibiotics over a three week period.i cold not eat during this time and was on oxycodone for pain. i tried to get a refund or exchange but they said since i was not hospitalized there would be no refunds. i am handicaped and live on a small pension so this money means a lot to me.this deal is a bad one so bewear before signing up for this. it could only hurt the little guy

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Loving40Now
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the other reviews I was a little nervous. So happy I took the chance and stayed at the Double Tree. Room was great, yes the bathrooms are a little small but do you really plan on sleeping in them? The staff cares and that's a big deal for me. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Jazzfest affordable but no frills”
Reviews.Author: crobbtu
Reviews.Content: Positives: the room was priced well for Jazzfest and there were two great guys (one working the main entrance and one at the front desk) who always greeted my friends and I with a smile. Negatives: The rooms were fairly rundown and definitely need updating. We called down for extra towels on two separate days and it took about an hour both times to have someone even come to our room and when they did come, they asked what we needed instead of knowing that we needed towels like we had asked for.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE --- and do NOT book the "ROMANCE PACKAGE"”
Reviews.Author: Rachie7899
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels, and this is by far the worst experience I have had. Starting with our check-in through our check out, we had several problems. LOCATION - next door to Harrahs Casino, a few blocks from Burboun Street - Great location. This is the only thing "great" about this hotel and experience. Oh yeah, and they have a Frozen Yogurt chain at its front door. :) CHECK-IN - arrived at 1pm, room not ready, went to gym in the meantime, which was small but clean and decent. We were called about an hour and a half later, and when I picked up my keys, we were not offered a cookie (as DoubleTree takes pride in this) and we did not receive our coupons for the "Romance Package" we had booked (per the website, this includes breakfast in bed every morning of our stay, a free bottle of champagne, and free access to the gym, which was FREE ANYWAYS!!!!!) CLEANLINESS - AWFUL! Our shower curtain smelled horrible (indescribable) and our comforter had a huge yellow stain on it (???urine? hopefully juice?) which was only discovered after a night of sleeping on it. I have a picture for proof if anyone is interested to see how obvious it was. I asked to get the shower curtain changed TWICE before someone actually came up to change it. The only upside to the TINY bathroom is the drain actually worked and didn't clog up on us like when we stayed at another unnamed hotel down the street. My boyfriend also found some sort of cricket or roach crawling up his leg when we were on our way out of our room!!!!! VALUE - for the $15 more per night extra that we paid for the "Romance Package" I would say it was definitely not worth it. Might as well eat breakfast around the hotel somewhere close by. Otherwise, the room rates were comparable to the surrounding hotels. ROOMS- as mentioned above, the room was very small. JUST ENOUGH room around the single queen bed for one couple, but I wouldn't recommend more than 2 people to this sized room. And I usually am able to squeeze!!! Bathroom was even smaller - You could be standing on the toilet and reach your arms to touch practically all four walls in the bathroom, not to mention the door would open up and bump your legs if you were sitting on it. Sleep quality was not good- pillows were not comfortable (and not even resembling real pillows, just mush covered with a pillowcase?) and the 2 bedsheets with the (soiled) comforter still kept me waking up cold in the middle of the night. SERVICE - Room service was 20 plus minutes late on the first morning - orderd it at 10am, and so we decided to leave at 10:20 am when breakfast hadn't arrived yet. The only person that was actually great was the gentleman who held on to our bags and ordered us a cab to the airport when we needed to leave around 10:15am - we headed out to a local restaurant for breakfast (Mother's - down the street) instead of using our last breakfast coupon - cab was on time! Otherwise, service was sub-par - again, DoubleTree takes pride in their warm cookies and not ONE of the staff members offered it to us at anytime. Even the lady who made eye contact with us at the front desk who was HOLDING the tray of cookies!!! CHECK-OUT - to top off the experience, they mistakenly charged us room service for our "Romance Package" breakfasts. The gentleman at the counter was able to refund this charge, thank goodness. Overall----- WORST HOTEL EXPERIENCE EVER. I'm not one to complain, but seriously, with all the other hotels in the area, this should really be a last resort choice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: RoadsisterSue
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on The Double Tree, New Orleans I was worried about our stay. I should have taken my father's advice..."don't worry about something that hasn't happened." My husband and I were in town for Jazzfest. My sister and her husband were staying with us. Yes, the rooms are small and yes, you can hear just about everything going on in the hallway but the beds were clean and comfortable and put us all right to sleep. Every employee we encountered did their best to make our stay comfortable. We asked for a few extra towels because we had four extra people in the room....they were there when we got back from the fairgrounds. Needed a sewing kit....it was brought up to our room in a matter of minutes. Needed directions.....got them and a great story to boot. If your looking for the perfect hotel....this isn't it....but, if you're looking for ... clean comfortable beds (no bedbugs!) extra fresh towels friendly staff great location fair price This is your place. RoadsisterSue PS check out the free ferry that runs on the 1/2 hour and takes you to Algiers. We went after dark, full moon, crescent city....can't get more romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, awesome room!!”
Reviews.Author: HouseFamilyTravel
Reviews.Content: We traveled using Hilton Points, so we were limited as to which property we could stay at. We were pleasantly surprised to find the French Quarter was only a block from the hotel, so everything was a very quick walk away. We rented a car so that we could travel outside of the downtown area, so we had to use valet parking (you can't self-park here). It was super convenient and worth the $30 charge! We just had to call downstairs 20-30 minutes before we needed the car, and it was ready and waiting for us. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. On our first night, one of the front desk clerks recommended Mr. B's for dinner. It turned out to be the best meal we had all week! The room was large, clean, quiet, and safe. We do not have any complaints about this hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: runner6326
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while attending a conference in NOLA. This hotel was the ideal distance between the convention center and French Quarter/Bourbon St. The bathroom was tiny, but since it was only me in the room, it didn't matter. The room size was decent, and the bed comfortable. The only noise issue I had was a neighbor that liked to wake up around 5 am and let his/her door slam several times over a 10 or 20 minute period. The fitness room is pretty limited, so it can be difficult to get on exercise equipment during certain times of the day. The continental breakfast was free (this might have been because of the conference or my Hilton Honors status), but there is a hot breakfast option for a small price. Overall, the staff was very friendly. Compared to the other hotel options for the conference, the price and location of the Doubletree were what won me over.

Reviews.Title: “Too Many Issues - Not a Good Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: engineer64
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is good for a close walk to Borbon street and right across from the casino. But the hotel is old and in need of a major ranovation rather than paint/carpet/wallpaper. The plumbing is poor. The noise of the adjoining rooms is amazing. It sounds as if high pressure water is coming through the wall. The bathroom is small. For the price, you would be better off trying another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...”
Reviews.Author: MrsCongeniality
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend with friends....not only was the double we reserved not available, but the room was sooo small. That bathroom was only big enough for one person to get ready (and to be honest, I have seen half baths bigger than this one). Also the air condtion was leaking down the wall and the carpet was wet. All I can say if you want a nice stay in NOLA, head elsewere.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible - Better hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: ATLBen
Reviews.Content: I just spent one night here during a business trip to New Orleans. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is that it is very close to the Quarter and a number of good places to eat.. That's it. The building was built some time in the 70's and it shows. My room was cold and dark and the AC was leaking and the carpet was wet. The bathroom is tiny - you can't even stand in front of the sink because the toilet is so close to the door. The restaurant in the lobby is billed as a creole-themed type place, but you might as well eat at McDonald's. Actually, McDonald's would be much better. I ordered room service and it was quite possibly the wort food I've ever had. Overcooked, bland chicken, mashed potatos drenched in butter sauce and limp green beans, not to mention the inedible bisque. To top if off, I ordered breakfast and, surprise, it was not delivered when it was supposed to be. I called about it when I was about to check out, and they said "Oh, we were going to be up in 5 mintues"...25 minutes late. Avoid this place at all costs. There are a number of other hotels within 100 yards of this location and I can say from experience that the Hilton Riverside and Loews are WAY better.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surfsidesandcrab
Reviews.Content: At first I was worried when we booked this hotel as per the other reviews. But I was plesantly surprised.(the good) 1. was able to ck in before ck in time. 2. room was very clean. 3. plenty of room for the 2 . 4. all of the employees were very helpful and smiling. Even saw the manager pitch in during the breakfast buffet. Giving help where ever it was needed.5. right across the st. from Harrah's and with in walking distance to French Market and Bourbon St. (needs work) 1. yes they do need some maintance work done around there. Can see some wear n tear in and on the building. More info at the desk on the breakfast buffet coupons at ck in. Ice maker not working on 5th floor....all in all yes I would go back to thi hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Mardi Gras Parade Route”
Reviews.Author: Rowand
Reviews.Content: Met my husband for a weekend get-away. Doubletree is on parade route so you have to plan around parades to get your car in and out. Comfortable but a bit shabby room. Breakfast is OK but when you think of all of the great food in NOLA, if you have money go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst expenerice ever”
Reviews.Author: bi6head
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubletree in New Orleans. I had the worst experience in my life. I booked 3 double bed rooms. We arrived at 12:30pm on March 5th . I understand that check in is not until 3pm. However, we did not get a room until 5:30pm. Also, I was given 2 double bed rooms and a single bed room. I was told they were all booked and they could not change my room that night. The next morning, they checked me out of the single bed room without giving me another room. I was told my room was ready at 5:30 pm. When I was went to the front desk, they said my room was ready. They gave me the same exact 1 bed room they checked me out of in the morning. I complained and they gave me double bed room. Therefore, I did not have a room for the whole day. Even though the new room I got had 2 beds, the sink was clogged. We had to call maintenance to unclog it. There was also no hot water in our room. The carpets were really dirty in all 3 rooms. I do not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I would have looked harder for a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: dina110
Reviews.Content: We arrived for Mardi Gras on Saturday. The streets were closed due to a parade so we were stuck a few blocks from the hotel with all our luggage and a light drizzel of rain. The the sky opened up and it poured down rain severe enough to end the parade ancd cancel the next one. Finally made it to the hotel soaking wet to find that there weren't any rooms ready. Ok, to be expected since this was about an hour before check in time at 3. Staff was bringing towels to put all around us since were were literally leaving puddles on the floor, but we were not offered any towels or anything to dry off with. Some staff memebers acted annoyed that they would have to clean up the puddles we were leaving. We left to grab a bite to eat and when we returned 2 hours later, still wet, and still no room. I was able to ask one of the bell hops to let me in my luggage so I could at least try to find some dry clothes which he did. Finally, a manager came by and we spoke with him and he assured us our room would be ready in 30 minutes. That was 2 and 1/2 hours after check in time. After the manager spoke with us, the staff was very friendly and helpful. I am sure this is always a stressful and busy time for the staff but more could have been done for us. The room was incredibly small, the floor was filthy and the room stayed damp our entire stay. It was a great location on the parade route and close the the French Quarter but I wouldn't stay here again. Bathrooms are especially tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, upkeep lacking, decent location”
Reviews.Author: niteflite
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night the week before mardi gras. The good: location is okay, not the best, but within walking distance of french quarter. Also I am a gambler so harrahs being across the street was useful. The bell staff was great! All friendly, very helpful. The bell captain in particular was great. The breakfast buffet was your standard doubletree fare. As an honors member we got vouchers. Also got two drink passes at bar downstairs where the bartender was very friendly. The bad: I was first put in an adjoining room and I could hear the entire conversations next door. Also when I went to use the bathroom upon getting settled, there was a cockroac on the tub. I requested a room change and it was granted, except the next room smelled of smoke. Another room change later I was put into a king size room. The hotel building needs some touching up throughout. Caulk in the bathrom is peeling, there is easily visible mildew, etc. But I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bjb1370
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the weekend before Mardi Gras. The location is excellent, just across the street from Harrah's Casino, and just a few minutes walk into the heart of the French Quarter. The staff was great, and the receptionist allowed me to check in early. The rooms with one double bed are small, and the bathroom tiny. The bed was very comfortable, the linens good quality and toiletries are Crabtree and Evelyn. There was a coffee maker in the room. The restaurant was small and was only open for breakfast. The entrances to the rooms adjoin each other, so when your neighbor goes into their room, it sounds like they've entered your room. This takes some getting used to. On a Priceline rate, I have no complaints. But to pay rack rate is a different story. If you have to pay full rate, consider another property. Expedia lists the property as a 3*, but it's more like a new 2 1/2 * hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH BETTER!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladybugtx76
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay back in the spring, we decided to give this hotel another try. It is close to the casino, and other sites, so we tried again. We were so glad that we did! MUCH BETTER!!! WE will definitely come back and suggest this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: victorianhouselover
Reviews.Content: There were good and bad things about this stay. Overall the staff was very nice and helpful except one lady in the dining room. The room was clean and comfortable, but small and a bit worn, but the bed was comfy. Our TV remote did not work and we called for a new one and it never came. We finally had to go get a new one the next day. Maid service was spotty. Some days we had everything we needed and others we were shorted towels and coffee. The walls are very thin and you can hear the conversations from people next door.The parking is expensive but their service was great and quick. The free breakfast was awful! the food was stale and old and not much of it. I skipped it even though it was free except for grabbing a coffee on the go. They do have warm cookies on check in and the location is great! close to leisure and the convention center. No fridge in the room which would have been really nice considering New Orleans is known for food and we often had left overs with nowhere to keep them. I would stay here again but would try to get a better rate It is a much better hotel than a Motel 6 type place but not up to the standards you would expect for Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly.”
Reviews.Author: imasianplum
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? -Parking in New Orleans can be very expensive. We had the valet take our car for the first night of our stay - $30/day+tax before we discovered you can park at Harrah's Self-Park Garage 2 blocks away for free if you gamble for 30 minutes - well worth it if you can avoid losing more than $30 in 30 minutes every day you park. When we called down from our room to have the car ready, it was outside in 10 minutes. You can request your car as many times as you like within that 24-hour period. The cost was automatically added to our room account. No problems, so far... When we checked out, we find that we were charged for parking each night of our stay. WHAT?! They saw our car one day and charged us for four. We had to get a supervisor to come out to remove the extra charges on our bill because the front desk woman helping us wanted us to go outside to talk to the parking manager about the charges (are you kidding?! - we have to go out to explain and correct THEIR mistake?!) and she couldn't seem to correct the bill herself on the computer. Apparently, the guys parking cars for the Doubletree are their own entity. That makes me feel REAL safe about leaving a car with them. It was all resolved in the end and the supervisor was kind to refund us the first night's parking, but what a mess. -One night of our stay we were wakened around 5am by a toxic odor coming into our room. It was as if someone dumped 10 gallons of nail polish on our carpet. We called down several times and the final explanation we got in the morning was that a maintenance man was finishing the elevator doors on the 2nd floor. Somehow the off-gases made it to our room and could not escape. We stuck a towel under the door to try and prevent more from coming in and then put on the air. In retrospect, we should have requested to move to another room, but who can think straight at that hour after inhaling chemical fumes in your sleep? The manager explained that the man working with the chemical didn't have a mask on himself, so he wasn't concerned that it was toxic to be breathing in. Well, that sure makes me feel confident that we're not going to have respiratory problems or killed off some brain cells. He was kind to refund us one night's stay, but again, what a mess. -The continental breakfast had exceptional bacon! Totally random! One of the waitresses was not particularly friendly. One morning she seated us in the far corner of a connected room when there were plenty of seats open in the main room. I kindly asked if we could sit in the main room, and she mumbled something under her breath and walked away from me. I just stood there wondering what just happened. After that, we went to the main room and sat ourselves. Nice attitude, lady. -One night of our stay we had some really loud neighbors next to us squealing and talking loud. It was pretty clear they had been drinking. After calling the front desk several times over the course of an hour around midnight to get them to quiet down, someone finally contacted them and we finally were able to get to sleep. It shouldn't have taken that long. -Housekeeping was fantastic. We don't bother with getting our room made on trips. Housekeeping noticed our "do not disturb" sign on our door and called each day to ask if we needed anything. We were out of the room a lot and they managed to call us when they noticed we stepped in. They were at our door with whatever we needed within minutes. Very nice housekeeping staff. -The Wi-Fi was pretty bad. It would cut in and out a lot. If you pay extra, you could get "upgraded" Wi-Fi service. I've never heard of a hotel that offers a low-grade AND high-grade Wi-Fi service. Why don't they just toss out the crappy Wi-Fi and have better Wi-Fi for everyone? Very strange. -The hotel location was great if you're here for a conference at the nearby Hilton. Harrah's is across the street. The Riverwalk Marketplace, French Quarter, and Arts District are short walks away. We were happy to accept the day of free parking and one night's stay, but it was disappointing how some staff initially handled situations. It was a bizarre stay. I would only recommend it if you're going to the Hilton for a conference and want to be in a good location relative to the Hilton and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Double Tree was really nice, but the bathrooms were really small..”
Reviews.Author: MeshiaRem
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Double Tree Hotel was fantastic!! It was conveniently located to several attractions. We were right across from Harrah's Casino, a block away from the Riverwalk, and about two blocks from Bourbon Street. So we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go. The staff was very friendly and offered us warm cookies and coupons for the free breakfast buffet upon arrival. The breakfast buffet was fantastic! The rooms were nice. The only disappointing feature was the extremely tiny bathrooms. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Kulemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights - before and after our cruise out of New Orleans. We booked thru expedia. The only thing I caution is we were a couple, but were charged an extra person charge of $19.13 per night which expedia said would be credited back to us as soon as the hotel reservations manager emailed and confirmed that they were not charging the extra person charge. As of today - I don't believe Laumel on the front desk has sent the email... : ( Anyway the staff were excellent. Allan the concierge was very helpful recommending restaurants and tours. The warm , welcome cookies were very good. My husband dropped his in the hallway and the housekeeping supervisor went and got him another one and delivered it to our room. All the staff seemed very friendly and helpful. When we arrived early on Friday the bellmen held our bags till our room was ready and they even called to let us know when it was available. Getting off the ship at 8 am we were surprised to find our room ready and waiting when we arrived at the hotel. That was a welcomed surprise. The breakfast buffet was very good and the staff also very friendly. The free internet in the lobby and bar areas was a welcomed benefit. The location to the French Quarter was great - a five minute walk to Bourbon Street and all their great restaurants. Harrah's Casino is directly across the street. We would definatley stay here again, as long as we didn't get charged the extra person charge : (

Reviews.Title: “OK...not quite up to Doubletree standards though”
Reviews.Author: TandJ_8
Reviews.Content: This place isn't bad, but not much to write home about either. Its a Doubletree so it isn't a dump, but its the worst of any Doubletree I have stayed at. The rooms are a bit outdated and there isn't much to the lobby area. Great location to walk to the quarter, across the street from Harrah's, @ the end of Canal, and a few blocks from Bourbon. The first room we were in had some strange noise that we couldn't sleep with, but to their credit they moved us immediately and things were fine. So if you just need a clean room in a pretty good location, this place works...just don't expect anything spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, they just don't have much to work with.”
Reviews.Author: JayhawkinBoston
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that the staff here was extremely friendly and responsive, especially Amelia at the front desk. The breakfast buffet is pretty solid too, and discounted for Hilton Honors members. However, the staff can't make the rooms larger. I've stayed at lots of hotels at different price ranges all over New Orleans, and this was the smallest room I can remember. The staff also can't make the walls more soundproof. You'll hear everything going on in the rooms next to you and above you and out in the hallway. Again, I'm no New Orleans rookie, I don't expect silence, I just didn't really care to follow the conversation our neighbors were having about the dresses the bridesmaids were wearing in the wedding. I should also mention that the location is pretty good. Right on Canal Street next to Harrah's, so it's a good base of operations for a trip. It's not a *terrible* deal overall for the price, and we weren't miserable or anything, but if you're used to staying at Doubletrees elsewhere in the country, the facilities here will probably leave you disappointed. But again, the staff does great with what they have to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of incidentals!!”
Reviews.Author: Maegan M
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel becuase it seemed to be a great value for the money, however after the incidentals, it wasn't such a great value. $30/day for parking. $15/day for internet use. In addition, the rooms weren't insulated well, and I heard most of what went on in the hall and the room next door. The location was great, and the staff was VERY friendly & helpful. Just be sure to include the incidentals when deciding what's the best value!!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, good value, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: canadiancaroline
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree is a smaller hotel, which is nice because you don't get lost in the shuffle. The rooms are average size but very clean and well appointed, the beds were super comfy and the water temperature/pressure in the bathroom was great. Included with the room rate was a complimentary buffet breakfast that was very good, it had everything one could possibly want from eggs to cereal to fresh fruit and more. My only quibble is that, after being out late Saturday night, it would have been nice of breakfast was more like brunch and lasted later than 11am. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this property as good value for the price and would not hesitate to stay there again. The location is ideal because it is close enough to walk to most attractions without being right in the Quarter ... you don't really want to stay right in the Quarter since it is loud and there are a lot of people out late.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: flymachine
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the staff and management for their professionalism and hospitality shown to me during my stay at the hotel during the Realtor Conference in early November. The one person in particular that made my stay an enjoyable one was Ms. Amelia Collins at the front desk. She is truly a credit to the hotel and I hope Hilton management recognizes her for her high level of customer service. I hope to return in the future and would definitely recommend Doubletree Hotel New Orleans to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place”
Reviews.Author: Redhead_Bostonian
Reviews.Content: Just came back from New Orleans very angry at this hotel management. The first night when we returned to our room around 11:00pm we realized that there is no running water and the toilets are not flushing. There was no note or voice message from the management to expalin or warn us about what is going on. When called the front desk, they sounded annoyed and expalined that the whole block is out of water. No offer to give us bottled water, no suggestion as to what to do if you need to go to the bathroom and said that the housekeeping has left and there is no bottled water. After a scandal, we made them open the cafe and get us some bottled water: 24hour store around the corner was closed for some reasons. Called husband at home who googled and told us that the whole city is out of water and not clear when they will get it back. Went to bed without a working toilet. In the morning the water was back. No apology, no explanation, no offer for any compensation. Husband informed that that there is boiling water alert for the whole city of New Orleans.NO WORD ON THAT FROM THE HOTEL MANAGEMENT! NOTHING- NO NOTE POSTED, NO WATER OFFERED in the next two days- all other hotels giving out water and plastered with notices not to drink from the tap. Nothing from our guys! However, on the third day, the notice appeared on the elevator that the boiling water order is lifted. I just cannot belive how they handled this situation. Will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fema can't even get this staff and management motivated”
Reviews.Author: MartyMidwest_USA
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that smells like an old smoky casino and restaurant staff that waits 15-minutes before asking you from the other side of the room if "You here for somethin", then stay at this property. Tables in the breakfast room stay unserviced forever with lines that make the Mississippi look short. Comment on the slum service to management and you will be on hold for an eternity. When you are lucky enough to be on hold for only 5-minutes, the manager responsible for the problem escalation will have the audacity to say "how can I help you?". If only the service staff asked the same question. This is a classic hotel of yester-year that will leave your clothing smelling as bad as the service when you leave. Good luck with this gem. At 209 per night, I might recommend spending 20 more for the place next door. Sincerely, Mr. 220 nights per year and diamond (for now) at the Franchiser of this slug. PS. 45-minutes have gone buy with still no name for the general manager. Time to involve corporate and the rest of the world!

Reviews.Title: “won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: airlandsee
Reviews.Content: the rooms smell. the hotel smells. moldy. the toilets in the rooms above below and next door sounded like canons all night long. the continental breakfast buffet was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: Jon Deaux
