Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had an unexpected opportunity to go to New Orleans for the weekend which was dependent upon finding a room with the Saints playing in town. We wanted a room somewhere near the French Quarter and booked a room at the Doubletree Hotel, as we had stayed there many years ago. After booking the room, I started reading some very negative reviews about the Doubletree and actually tried to cancel my online reservation, but was not able to because we were within the 72 hour cancellation policy. I told my wife that we had a room in New Orleans, but may have made a mistake booking a room at the Doubletree, but really did not have another option. Our arrival and check in was a pretty easy and quick process. We went up to our room and tried to enter but our card keys would not work. I immediately started having bad thoughts about our stay. I went back down to the font desk, explained to another clerk that our keys would not work and the clerk looked up our information and told me that we had the correct keys, but the other clerk had put the wrong room number down on our folio. After reading many of the negative reviews, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised at how nice our room was. None of the negative remarks about dirty carpeting, peeling paint, insects, etc, were present in our room. The only negatives were the bathroom was pretty small and crowded, and our remote control for the TV did not work very well. A bottle of champagne was delivered to our room during our stay, as part of our package. They also brought us bottled water and chips, which was an unexpected but appreciated amenity. We also thoroughly enjoyed the full hot breakfast buffet in the AM as part of our room package. Valet parking is the only option available, but if you have ever spent much time in the French Quarter, valet parking at the hotel was an excellent option for us. The hotel is within a very short walk to Riverwalk, the Aquarium, and the French Quarter, the usual tourist attractions. Our short stay was made even more pleasant with the help of Jake who helped us with last minute reservation for dinner on a Saturday night for 10 people. I initially thought Jake was the concierge, but is also the bellman, and really took care of us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE. EVER.”
Reviews.Author: ABell07
Reviews.Content: I am literally sitting in our bed as I write this review...and I'm awake because I can hear every word/noise/flush/breath of the people in the rooms on either side of us. When we checked in, after calling to CONFIRM we had a king non-smoking, the HORRID "manager" callously, without even looking us in the eye, insisted we were wrong and insisted we reserved a double smoking room. After them doing this to now 3 extremely pissed off guests at the same time and after I called corporate to get her fired, she all of a sudden had non smoking rooms for us and basically threw us the keys without so much as a "f.u.". This is hands down the most pathetic excuse for a hotel EVER. I have NEVER written a bad review on here before and rely on trip advisor very often so please take my advice and stay somewhere else. Along the dang river would be better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: elviejo1951
Reviews.Content: Good location on the edge of the French Quarter, but the hotel is worn and lacks attractiveness. The lobby bar looks like it belongs in a budget motel. The paint on the bathroom door in our room, and that of our fellow travelers, was quite chipped. We have stayed in other Doubletree Hotels and fell well short of the standard of the others. We were only staying 2 nights so we didn't move hotels, but our fellow travelers who were staying in New Orleans 2 more nights moved to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly People, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mbartelt216
Reviews.Content: I stayed her for 2 days on business. I've been to a lot of hotels and was surprised at how friendly everyone was...asking how you were, if they can get anything for you. They were very accomodating. Rooms were clean; price was good (half that of other hotels in walking distance)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mommabuck
Reviews.Content: I'm usually a fan of Doubletree, but was very disappointed in the cleanliness and general service. There were no glasses in the bathroom, although I called the desk and asked for them, and the room did not seem thoroughly cleaned. A colleague found roaches in his room and complained that his room didn't seem up to standards either. With so many wonderful hotels in New Orleans, I'm surprised that this Doubletree didn't try a little harder because the price was fine and the value excellent. Location couldn't be beat either.

Reviews.Title: “Be Very Careful with Your Credit Card at This Hotel-DOUBLE CHECK THE DOUBLETREE”
Reviews.Author: Skydancer36
Reviews.Content: When I checked in, I inquired of the desk clerk how much they would authorize on my credit card (since I had a limited per diem). I was told it would be $25.00. Imagine my surprise to discover that they authorized EVERY SINGLE CENT THEY COULD GET OFF MY CREDIT CARD, and left me nothing to travel home on. It took THREE weeks to get the money back on my card. I feel deceived, and I will NEVER stay at a Hilton Property ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel - but be wary!”
Reviews.Author: elkayandboro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree on Canal Street in NOLA in June 2010. It's a superior location because of it's proximity to Harrah's Casino, the Riverwalk Marketplace, Canal Street, the French Quarter, etc. It's all within a 5 minute walk. Be careful in selecting a room at the front desk, some rooms are renovated, some aren't, and there's a BIG difference between the two. The Doubletree website offered a great rate plus breakfast buffet for 2 each day, so check the hotel website before reserving. All in all, a nice, economical (for NOLA), quiet, comfortable stay in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wish that I had not ignored the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Shmyra
Reviews.Content: I don't think that this hotel has ever been renovated. This was surprising because it is a Hilton associate. The walls, the carpet are just disgusting, especially the carpet. I was there for a convention for 6 nights. For three days and nights, we had water standing in the bathroom floor. At first, they could not figure out where it was coming from so they removed the stool and caulked a couple of times. After the third day, it was fixed. The room was very close, especially the bathroom was tiny, had no fan to vent ordors, door was difficult to close. The walls are so thin you could hear other guests talking. The ice machine on our floor was broken most of the time. We had to call room service for ice. We had requested a non-smoking room, but the smoke smell was so strong housekeeping came to spray. This did not help.

Reviews.Title: “Many better places in New Orleans for a comparable price”
Reviews.Author: eaglebac
Reviews.Content: I was very unimpressed by this hotel. The staff was not very professional and seemed to me like they were always waiting for a tip instead of providing genuine service. Location was good, but no better than the other major hotels. Also, I could hear the water running in rooms around me as if someone was showering in my own bathroom - it was very unsettling!

Reviews.Title: “It was OK...”
Reviews.Author: Jsaxm
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference in New Orleans and booked my stay at the Doubletree. I had stayed at doubletree hotels before, so I was expecting a certain level of comfort and service. I have to say that while my stay wasn't terrible, it wasn't what I remembered a doubletree being like. The rooms were somewhat small, which was ok as a solo traveler, but had my wife been there with me it would have been a difficult fit. There was a small closet which was interesting to use since I was going to be there for a week. The bathroom was also not very big with a toilet that looked like the kind you would see in many public restrooms across the country. The shower was ok and they provided some nice lotions, etc. The major downfall of this hotel is the noise. Granted, I was there during the Essemnce Music Festival, not attending it, just happened to be there at the same time. Before the festival started and after it had ended the noise was better, but there is still a lot of noise from normal doors closing. It's a bit of a problem when you can hear the entire door closing and locking process from the rooms all around you. The bathrooms were also not very sound-proof as I could hear my neighbors having conversations at all hours of the night. The food was good. Room service was timely and efficient. The food had a lot of flavor and arrived to my room hot. Very friendly delivery people as well. Overall my stay was ok, but I would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Racist and mildewed!!!”
Reviews.Author: scw601
Reviews.Content: Where do i start.. 1. The guy that checked me in was flirting wth the (male) customers, when i walked up he got pissed. 2. I paid for my room and instead of giving me my change back he sat it on the counter. 3. There were no parks at the hotel available, so i had 2 park 2 blocks away. 4. When i got to the room it had 2 b the worst room available, it felt damp and was covered in mildew. 5. Got anther room and by the time i sat down, security was knocking on my door saying i was making 2 much noise going thur the doorway with my luggage. DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, avoid this location...”
Reviews.Author: gregt74
Reviews.Content: Terrible place to stay, i had stayed at the Ritz carlton the night before I was scheduled to stay here for work, the Ritz was $200 a night, while this was $165 and that was with a conference discount. the difference in quality was 10 times the difference in price. It was horrid. I promptly found another hotel, which was NICER and cheaper and personally paid the one night the hotel forced me to pay despite being there less than an hour. Now I'm on the phone disputing a mysterious charge for another night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, value, and cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: neeko34
Reviews.Content: Solid stay. Rooms clean, great location, and great hospitality. A few blocks from French QTR, right next to Harrah's Casino and Mississippi River. I found our stay pleasant. Only drawback was parking (Valet $32). I got around that by parking on street for $0. Arrive at 5pm and meter parking not required after 6pm. Took a chance and got away with it.

Reviews.Title: “Below Hilton Standard”
Reviews.Author: TRUBLU5
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a convenient location as it is across from an upscale shoppping mall, casino, Canal street trolley, and Riverwalk. Check in went smoothly. Cookies were hot even though we checked in at 9 PM. We were told to park in the parking garage across the street. There is not a hotel discount for parking there so just pay at the garage exit ($20.00 per night). Out hotel room had a wet and mildewed ceiling tile, and the commode had a seal leak and seeped water on the floor. Bathrom vent was full of dust. Rooms are small, and there is little sitting room in the hotel lobby or elsewhere in the hotel. Hotel pool is adequate, though there is a minimum number of plastic lounge chairs. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I find these items to be bothersome. They are putting money into the construction of a new entrance facade when more attention needs to be given to the interior to bring it to expected standards.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: traveling_lawteacher
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the worse experience I have ever had at a hotel. Our reservation was placed two months in advance for a non-smoking room with two beds from July 2-7, 2010. We are staying five nights at $190 a night and this is what we got, a smoking room with one bed, and was only told at the front desk that it was going to be a smoking room, nothing about the one bed, when she asked us how many beds we needed, oh they provided a roll-a-way, only thing is I had to move the chair into the hallway to fit the bed. The t.v. was older than me and the speaker was shot. the bathroom was so small you have to step into the tub to close the door, no fridge in the room, doors are cheap and horrible. only sheets on the bed no blankets/quilts, plus on top of that, i had to pay $14.95 a night for internet. I will never recommend this hotel! how can you take a reservation and state that it will be held till 10am the following morning, yet not provide what was requested in the reservation? What if someone in my party was allergic to smoke, asthmatic, or worse... we wouldn't have gotten a room? completely unacceptable no wonder I will continue to stay at the comfort suites... free internet, modern amenities(flat screens) oh and $85 a night. unsatisfied doesn't even come close to how I feel. the only good thing out of this whole stay was the hot cookie when I got here and mine wasn't even hot. You can take that cookie and... well i'm sure you can figure out the rest. Thanx for nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer service by housekeeping manager”
Reviews.Author: BogartChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel on Sunday and the room we were given did meet our needs. The desk staff were very accomodating and switched us to another room. Later that evening we discovered that we left our phone chargers in the first room. The housekeeping staff had left for the day. On Monday we told our server (Marie) in the restaurant about our situation. Marie was very eager to help us,she immediatley contacted housekeeping and put us in touch with Lucia (housekeeping manager). Lucia was so friendly and understanding of our situation that she came to our room with some chargers (we needed two types) and we found one that worked for one of our phones. When we showed Lucia the type we still needed she said that she would find it. 30 mimutes later she knocked on our door with our charger in hand. My wife and and I could see the pride in Lucia's face knowing that she helped us. Cell phones are as important to a traveler as is a room, car rental,etc. The chargers themselves are expensive, so it is great to see a person,like Lucia, come to our rescue. I hope the hotel recognizes what value a people person/hard worker like Lucia is to the Double Tree Hotel. Thank You Bill Burke San Diego CA>

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and poor room conditions”
Reviews.Author: Memgal54
Reviews.Content: Our first problem was upon arrival when we were told we could not park our car instead we were given poor directions to a public garage about 5 miles away We had requested a roll away bed but upon check in were told they had not placed one but said they would When we arrived at room keys would not work we had to wait 20 min and 2 phone calls before correct keys were given to us I could go on about more specifics but bottom line is that we never received rollaway after speak to front desk numerous times the air conditioning system would not work room walls were paper thin and we could get no sleep will never return here

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: gjperera
Reviews.Content: Came here for conference and was the last hotel available (now I see why). The staff was friendly and I even dealt with the service guys (my ac wasn't cooling) they were curteous and fixed the problem. The rooms are dated, small tv, expensive Internet which was very slow so I only used it fr one night, parking is a rip off, and the bathroom is tiny. Overall I would not stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Stay in N'Awlins”
Reviews.Author: Mbuker
Reviews.Content: had a great time! very comfortable... nice rooms

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: JustSchneider
Reviews.Content: When I found Doubletree Hotel New Orleans I was very excited about the location and price. I booked it right away for 3 nights. After the first night, however, I quickly lost all excitement and just got out as soon as possible. The toilet still held onto a few of the pubic hairs from the previous guest. I heard every sound in the hallway and many from people's rooms (the guy vomiting was the low-light). The morning of checkout, before the noon time, my wife and I went to get breakfast. When we returned, the toilet had been used, left unflushed, and smelled horrible. The staff was great; the beds were comfortable. But that's not enough to make this more than a terrible stay.

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare of a stay”
Reviews.Author: ladybugtx76
Reviews.Content: The parking situation was AWFUL! The noise level was AWFUL and even worse! We had three sets of door keys that had to be made during our stay. NEVER again will we stay here! We had problems before, and this visit was even worse. NEVER again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oxfordcook
Reviews.Content: The friendly helpful staff at this hotel make it a great place to Stay. The desk staff are helpful and friendly (also kind with the delicious cookies). The luggage guys like Calvin are so helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and well attended. Location wise it is also good. Not exactly in the quarter but within walking distance. It might be a little trickey to find because it doesn't storefront on canal. Just a short streetcar ride to the World War II museum on Magazine Street.

Reviews.Title: “Company convention during Mardi Gras.”
Reviews.Author: mcroman83
Reviews.Content: Our company's annual convention was held in New Orleans on purpose to coincide with Mardi Gras. This hotel has the perfect location as it is within a short walking distance from Shops at Canal Place, Harrah' s Casino, Audobon Aquarium, Algiers/Canal St Ferry, St Louis Cathedral and of course the French Quarter/Bourbon St. The service is top notch from the front desk to housekeeping. I loved the warm, freshly baked cookies they hand you as you check in. My only complaint would have to be PARKING. PARKING,PARKING, PARKING! It is horrible, as I pulled in the valet said their parking was at capacity. So I had to drive a block and pay $35/day at a pay lot and drag my stuff back to the hotel. My other complaint would have to be internet access. They charge $12 a day for wireless access and let me tell you IT IS UNRELIABLE. It would drop my connection SEVERAL times a day. Stay for the convenient location but be prepared to deal with these inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: tuesdaygal
Reviews.Content: We were treated like family. Everyone was friendly and warm. The beds were wonderful, (clean smelling sheets and very comfortable bed) Made the trip memorable, we wanted to take a bit of New Orleans home with us.

Reviews.Title: “Value not an issue”
Reviews.Author: MBNick
Reviews.Content: Went on business at the last minute. Guess this is why the hotel was one of the last left. We did get 1 night free with every two we stayed....but....room was tiny. When my wife checked in she was told no Kings but 2 queens. Got to the room and it was one queen. Told the desk made a mistake. Only chair in the room was the desk chair. Was just enough room for a real chair but none ther. Bathroom is probably the smallest I ever been in forgetting about price which averaged $170, plus parking. The bar is ok. You have to get the employees out of the way so you can see the TV they are watching Food services are awful. Breakfast is basically a $20.pp buffet. They have a worthelss Starbucks that might have a stale danish to go with your over priced coffee. Better coffee is no charge around the corner with an apple. Dinner is basically a $13.+ burger at a little table in the bar. You can go to the casino right next store and get a real burger for $5.99. Parking is $32. per day plus tax and interent is also a rip off so we did not use. Having spent several days there and talking to others it seems like ALL of New Orleans is a rip off with medicore service. The place was clean, most of the services were good. But I think I would try some place else just to compare

Reviews.Title: “Service Made My Trip!”
Reviews.Author: clairlorraine45
Reviews.Content: Last minute on a Sunday evening I realized I needed a place to stay. I went to several other hotels but DoubleTree was the only one to treat me with respect and give me a reasonable price. The next day when I left I LEFT ALL MY CLOTHES in the closet. I didn't realize until that evening after I arrived home. I called, the staff found my clothes and sent them directly to me clean and folded and without any hassle what so ever. Without the staff the hotel wouldn't be nearly as wonderful as I believe it to be. I plan to stay there the next time I visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “mixed bag.....but considering everything, I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Joandio
Reviews.Content: OK - I booked this place about 8 weeks prior to travel, when the rooms were still $116 for a Saturday night on Doubletree/Hilton site. As the travel date drew close, I would reprice and the rate climbed to over $200. $116 was a bargain, but the place isn't worth $200. I had room 1022 - very small, some mildew on in the closet in the corner, and right down the hall from the housekeeping closets (they banged their doors day and night). The bed was comfortable and the staff was very courteous. I didn't know this when I booked the hotel, but I was thrilled to see it was at the same intersection as Harrah's Casino so I lost $50. The hotel is also right at a trolley car stop on Canal Street. $116 - yep, I'ld stay there again in a heartbeat. $200 - no can do. Book early and tolerate the inconveniences in exchange for a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Should have done more research”
Reviews.Author: alaxmen
Reviews.Content: We chose the DoubleTree for Mardi Gra due to its location and even that ended up being a problem. It is located across the street from a casino and at the end of the parade route. From the point of arrival we had problems. While the rooms were nice but out-dated, they charged $35 for a extra key for our daughter to our room. Valet parking is $40 and public (located across canal street in another hotel) was $18 and the hotel had no transportation to/from the public parking. They advertise a Starbucks location but it is only a kiosk that serves on house blends only. Their breakfast buffet was $26 which was more than the casino which had a full Starbucks, McAlisters, a burger joint and multiple restaurants. Their entrance way only had room for four (4) cars maximum and you could never find a valet. Several guests including us were given bad directions to the hotel not only once but multiple times. They charge for everything that most hotels in other cities offer as free or part of your package.

Reviews.Title: “Surely NOT a Doubletree! Awful...”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoan_008
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel smelled like sweaty bodies, the connecting doors to another room allow you to hear every cough, conversation (including smutty ones), the room doors slam so loudly you'll be disturbed every time they do - three nights there and did not have one full night's sleep, even with a very good bed (will give them credit for that!) Had a smoking room (by request) that reeked - every hotel knows how to clean up a smoking room after previous guests - except this one, evidently! Broken alarm clock never replaced despite 3 days of requests. Desk staff utterly unknowledgable - could not even print off boarding pass. "Business Center" inoperative, dirty, malfunctioning insanely slow internet connection - and no one seemed to care (and $0.50/page printing fee had anything worked!) Have stayed at MANY Doubletrees - this one should lose its franchise/license. Very bare-bones and less than a "value" hotel. Coffee stand open odd hours and poor service. Housekeeping came one morning at 8:30 a.m. - WHAT??? And never showed up later, either... No on-site parking; valet parking rarely there; no bell service offered; cabs had to be called rather than a cab-stand. My counsel: CHOOSE ANOTHER NEW ORLEANS HOTEL! Yes, it's across the street from Harrah's, and convenient to French Quarter, but this does NOT make up for it being quite unsatisfactory in nearly all respects. Heck, even the COOKIE was cold, not warm!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: jesuit57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree and son and daughter in law and two friends also had rooms. We were there for Super Bowl weekend which was also the first weekend of Mardi Gras. Everyone that we encountered from the valet parking, front desk, restaurant, maids, and the lounge were extremely courteous and pleasant, even though the place was hectic due to all of the activities.. We had planned to go to the French Quarter to watch the Super Bowl at a sports bar, but decided instead to stay in the Hotel Lounge. Best decision we could have made. Drinks was reasonable, teriffic staff, By kickoff the place was packed, almost 200 fun loving people enjoying themselves and not one problem The waitresses and bartenders were non stop. A security officer passed though several times but was never needed. Rooms were extremely clean and had a great overall experience. We definitely will return and will recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience we have ever had due to security issues.”
Reviews.Author: monet99
Reviews.Content: The maid used her key card to let two men enter our rooms. We had removed the do not disturb sign from our door and she assumed we had gone out for the day. She did not knock or identify herself as housekeeping prior to letting them in the room. We happened to be in the room and they quickly exited. After notifying the manager of the situation, he said they would "look into it". We discovered later that the maid had been fired but we received no apology from the hotel staff. In fact, we felt they were very indifferent about the whole situation. Our room had been booked through Harrahs Casino (they were booked solid due to a Saints game). To Harrahs credit, they were able to find us a room at their hotel later in the day and moved us from the Doubletree with many apologies. Also, we might add that we were not pleased with the Doubletree room as we found it very noisy (we could hear conversations in the room next to us and in the hallway and doors slamming all night throughout the time we spent there). There was no in-room safe and fortunately we had put our valuables in a safe at the front desk upon our arrival there. We had intended to stay there for 5 or 6 nights but two was more than enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Essence music festival”
Reviews.Author: Wssu98grad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok. A little older than your average double tree but still tolerable. It's in the best location. It's on the corner of canal and poydras. Directly across from the harrahs casino! And they give you the best chocolate cookies when you check in!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mbw119
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nightmare. Yes, it is centrally located, but so are 50 other hotels that are nicer and have more competent staff. When we first arrived the non-smoking room we reserved smelled like smoke. We switched rooms but had to downgrade from our King size bed to a Double room. Then we realized that the room was missing the hair dryer. It took the staff over 90 minutes to find us one. Our room key cards only worked for 24 hours, so each day we had to go have them reset. The walls are paper thin so you can hear the people next door going to the bathroom, having conversations are normal speaking volume etc. When we would complain about something the staff would suggest that it was our fault that things weren't working properly. I stay in hotels 10-12 nights per month and this was one of the worst experiences I've had. I highly recommend choosing a different hotel. The business district has a very large selection and all are within walking distance to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieM30
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to stay!! Parking was available!! A nice central location to all the Highlights in New Orleans!! We have stayed here 3 different times! It is right across from Casino and a few blocks away from Bourbon Street!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Readyright
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks great from the outside, and is located in my favorite part of the city. The inside of the hotel is just average. I found, as did other travelers, that the bathroom is unreasonably small and the walls are thin. These rooms need an upgrade. My room was clean, but I found may small things that were annoying. The furniture was old an scratched up. The bed was not as comfortable as other Hilton properties. The hot water in the shower would only run lukewarm at times. I usually go with the flow, and I was not really upset. I was just disapointed since I have had better experiences at other Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location, bad soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: waytogo99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were here for a 3 night stay, and had a really great time overall. First the good stuff -The hotel is really centrally located for the French Quarter, CBD and Warehouse district, and close to street cars. The staff was nice and efficient, and the rooms were nice and clean as well, with the usual amenities that you would expect (ie. coffee maker, flat screen tv). The bed was comfy, not too hard or soft, although sheets were a little scratchy- as if too much starch was used in laundering them. The Fitness room was small, but had nice Precor machines with individual TVs and some weights to the side - enough equipment to get a good workout in. We bid for the room on priceline and got it for a cheap rate so were concerned that we'd be given the worst rooms, but instead we had a nice room on one of the mid-upper floors. Now the not so great parts - First, if you need a car, be warned that parking is very expensive here - about $34 per night. We opted not to rent a car during our stay due to the cost to park it, and just walked, or took the streetcar/cabs everywhere. Second, to get wireless internet in your room it's about $12 per night. However, if you opt not to pay that, you can still get free wireless internet access on the first or second floors. last, but perhaps the most important, the soundproofing from room to room is dismal. When ever our neighboor opened and closed their door, it sounded like our door was being opened it was so loud. All the doors slam shut, and creats quiet a racket in doing so. The toilets are also incredibly loud when flushed - sounds like a jet engin when ours is flushed, and like a motorcycle being reved up when it's our neighboors that is being flushed... ! and be prepared to hear your neighboors conversations if both of you happen to be in the bathroom at the same time.. It wasn't too bad on this trip since our neighboors were not obnoxiously loud, but we still woke up a couple of times due to a combination of the above... Overall a nice hotel, especially if you don't need parking, and can get it at a low price. But if you are a light sleeper- bring ear plugs, or go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud & Parking”
Reviews.Author: Shackejr
Reviews.Content: The room was ok. But as soon not had any doors, you can at of noise from the hall ways, I know you are going to get some sound, but it was very loud at times, with people coming in all hours of the night, you hear every word said, doors need to be sound proofed alittle better. I had to pay $38 a night just to park my car, what a rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Price & Service....small rooms”
Reviews.Author: jdwiley
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel makes it quite a steal. ($62/nt when we stayed) You can walk to the French Market or the French Quarter. The staff was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: TulaneFan11
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with my room and the great service I received at the front desk. I found the staff helpful and very pleasant. The location was great with easy walking distances to the French Quarter, other points of interest and great restaurants in the immediate area. Room service was on time and my breakfast arrived hot and ready to enjoy. I would recommend this hotel for the start of a great stay in Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: GVRBill
Reviews.Content: Good: Location, location, location Warm welcome at check-in Bad: Maid repeatedly shorted us on towels and only left one coffee pod per day Bed looked comfy but was actually way, way too soft Newspaper at door only once in three days Easy chair does not face the TV No free internet anywhere in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Old, worn, not so good.”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaFoodLover
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend our anniversary in New Orleans and being a Hilton Diamond member, I chose the Doubletree New Orleans. The reason I continue to use Hilton over most other hotel chains is their loyalty program. I don't want any special treatment, just what is promised me as I stay in with the same chain over and over. When checking in I asked about breakfast as it was included for Diamond members. I was told that was not my chosen benefit. I knew it was as they have no executive floor and therefore are supposed to include breakfast. Why is it my job to tell them this and have to act like I am asking for something "extra". They were very nice about it, but come on. Know your own company's policy. We checked into a very worn room after passing through a messy hallway. This hotel is in dire need of renovation. What really is a bummer is the breakfast. They wanted to charge us extra for some of their powdered eggs that we tried as it is not part of the free breakfast. Come on man. Bread and cold cereal is pretty much all that was included. Needless to say we refused. The staff was very nice about it, but... We decided to have some drinks as we were given some free drink coupons when checking in. The restaurant and lounge was closed until 5 PM so we went to check out Harrah's across the street and came back at about 5:40 PM. Still closed. We were told we could go to the bar. Again, the staff is very nice. I had to show the bartender how to make a chocolate martini for my wife. Although completely clueless, the bartender was extremely nice. I needed to use the computer in the business center and it was the slowest computer I have been on in years. It also had one of those add pasted desktop screens where you couldn't just navigate where ever you wished. Old stuff! The place is just worn down and run amateurishly. Nice staff, but find a better spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great for casino visitors”
Reviews.Author: atltraffic
Reviews.Content: When you walk out the front door of this hotel, you are greeted with the Harrah's casino directly across the street. The purpose of my trip was to do some gambling at the casino, so this worked out perfectly, at about 1/4 the price of a room at Harrah's. My room was on the 11th floor. I never had any issues with the elevator, which seemed pretty zippy. Check-in took about 90 seconds, including cookie. (I was prepaid - which helps). The room was very nice, with an extremely comfortable bed. My view was not too spectacular - looked out towards the side of the Sheraton. On my last night, I asked for a cab to be called for my 6 am departing flight. Right on cue at 4:30 am, I entered the lobby and my cab was waiting for me. Nice!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: completelygrossedout
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small and bathroom very cramped. The hallway is very noisy. Guest services are non-existant. Asked for a refrigerator for medical purposes twice and never received it. Parking charge was expensive and no bellman to help with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gmwrdh
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 20th anniversary with a "staycation" in our hometown of N.O. and we were very excited to do so.. Upon arriving at the hotel we were checked in quickly and on our way to our room with our Choc Chip cookies. The first night that we were in the room we noticed the sconce light blinking after we turned off the light, we thought it might have something to do with the fluorescent bulb so we unscrewed the bulb and went to sleep. We reported it to the hotel and were told that it would be taken care of. The next night we experienced the same thing and reported it again, this time we waited until maintenance came to fix it and upon removing the light cover it was discovered that there was a short- it had apparently not been checked the previous day. We were to be moved to another room and on trying to enter, although there was no guest in the room, it was obviously occupied- luggage and shopping bags in the room. After my husband stood in the hall with all our luggage on a luggage cart for 20 minurtes they finally found a room for us. We were given a breakfast voucher and some cookies for our trouble. Overall the staff tried to correct the problems but we we disappointed with the experience. The hotel is older and needs to be "freshened up"

Reviews.Title: “Really really nice double tree”
Reviews.Author: linzerhi
Reviews.Content: I like to stay at doubletrees when i travel and this is one of the nicest ive stayed. Rooms were bigger than average and beds were amazing. It also had a great location for our trip which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, first rate staff!”
Reviews.Author: ChapinW
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Doubletree in New Orleans several times in the past years. Each stay is like being in a five star hotel. The rooms are very nice, spacious and quiet; something you appreciate in New Orleans. The staff always speaks and it's not unusual for them to call you by name. The hotel is a great value and is convenient to most anything you would want to see in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location!!”
Reviews.Author: Berta26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights taking advantage of a "3rd night free" deal on the Doubletree website. We chose this hotel based on its cheaper price compared to nearby hotels, location and previous good experiences in Doubletree hotels. Our double room was clean and comfortable. The main thing about this hotel is its perfect location on Canal Street-close to Harrahs, the streetcars, Mississippi River and Bourbon Street. This hotel was a fair bit cheaper than neighboring hotels (even without the 3rd night free deal). Other reviewers complained about rooms/bathrooms being on the small side but if its simply somewhere to rest your head for the night when out enjoying the sights of New Orleans then I personally think it is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fortwaynejerry
Reviews.Content: We were comped at this hotel by Harrah's, so did not have to pay anything. After reading some of the reviews, we were a little apprehensive, but found this to be a very nice hotel. The rooms were great with plenty of towels and amenities. Bathroom was on the small size but not really a problem. There was a nice bar and an excersize room and a pool. Everyone was pleasant and helpful, even taking me into the office to print boarding passes when the lobby computer kiosk wasn't working, The location was excellant, across the street from the casino and about four blocks to Bourbon street and about five blocks to cafe du monde. The only negative for us was the loudness in the halls and from doors closing, but since we didn't spend much time in the room it wasn't a problem. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A-1”
Reviews.Author: YesNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was a little apprehensive. Everything was Great. Yes, the bathrooms are a little small, but so what. The staff was most gracious, the rooms were clean, the location was the greatest. What more can you expect. We had stayed there pre Katrina and enjoyed it just as much. Thumbs up..

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: J-W-P-Dallas
Reviews.Content: The Doubletree has a great location for a New Orleans stay and is in general a good choice. My main complaint is one they can't change--the windows are too small. However, with my small window I did have a great view of the Mississippi and Harrahs. The casino, Insectarium, Aquarium, IMAX, the street car, and the Shops at Canal are all steps outside the door. The French Quarter starts right across the street. Beds were very comfortable and the amenities quite satisfactory. Doors slammed hard so it was a little noisy and bathrooms are small but nice. If you are not a hotel snob and you get a good price, this should suit you well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: runnyhead
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located conveniently on Canal Street at the edge of the French Quarter near the river. When we arrived, the rooms were ready to go and checking was painless, the cookies were awesome! The louge downstairs was a good place to catch a drink before heading out each night. We were within walking distance to everything in the French Quarter and catching a cab in front of the hotel was easy. The trolley has a stop in front of the hotel, Harrah's is next door, the aquarium , the mall and a move theater are all across the street. The hotel restaurant was good, not the best considering it's New Orleans, but good for hotel food. I didn't have a car this trip, but you have to pay for parking in most places in the quarter. The pool is small, but nice to hang out at mid afternoon and there is a small gym for a quick work out. I've staryed in many places in the French Quarter over the years and this is one of the better experiences I have had. I was pleasantly suprizes at how much I liked the location.

Reviews.Title: “"Tragic" would be an understatement”
Reviews.Author: Buckhead720
Reviews.Content: Check-in took 40 minutes, and the lobby was fairly crowded. They had one person working the desk at 4pm check-in time and this person, unfortunately, actually took a cell phone call (personal) in the middle of someone's check-in. Efficiency was definitely not the keyword here. The room was OK, but as other posters have stated, the bathroom is indeed microscopic. My shower leaked and continually dropped water from the showerhead ... splop splop splop, the entire stay. Restaurant was also inefficient ... two servers for a crowd of about 20 people at 9am of a Saturday. Hostess was on cell phone (personal) a good part of the time I was there. Food, so-so, typical chain hotel fare, nothing bad but certainly nothing special. The deadbolt on my door was working loose. By day 2 it became unuseable. I reported it. As I check out, it remains loose and thus rendered useless. I found an odd stain on the decorative pillow on the bed, which makes me wonder how often (or if ever) those little pillows are cleaned. This was nasty and a real turn-off in an otherwise tastefully appointed room. Doubletree, how about just trashing the nasty pillow and replacing it? Would that bankrupt the chain? I didn't drive, but parking here is $36/day. Outrageous! There's a security-patrolled pay lot two blocks down the street for $11 day. Pool and gym were OK for a hotel of this type. I noticed a lot of debris (newspapers, cups, used towels) lying around the pool area for nearly two days before staff came along to clean the area. Hotel is the closest one to Harrah's Casino, just across the street. Biggest observation about this hotel: many of the staff seemed glued to their cell phones making personal calls during working hours. This doesn't make a good impression. I won't be back at this location even though I got a fairly good internet "deal."

Reviews.Title: “Good location! Small bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: chellelsu
Reviews.Content: My husband and recently returned from a weekend in New Orleans. The hotel location is great, within walking distance to everything in the French Quarter. The staff was friendly and greeted us each time we entered the hotel. The room was a decent size w/ 2 double beds. However, the bathroom was really small. It was tight with 1 person in there, so there is no way two people could fit in there at one time . Not sure if our bathroom was smaller because of our room location. We were at the end of the hall on the 14th floor. Either way, the bathroom was nuisance. We might stay at this hotel again however would probably stay up the road at either the Marriott or Sheraton. I have stayed at both of those hotels before and the little extra cost is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: bhojo
Reviews.Content: the hotel had a great location-right on canal street, it is in close proximity to the french quarter, downtown, and shops and restaurants. Their free cookies were great.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel from the staff to the rooms to the location”
Reviews.Author: Karrie C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America Youth Gathering. 850 youth and their leaders out of a total 36,000 stayed in the Doubletree. I was part of the troubleshooting team for the gathering, acting as a liason between the hotel and the groups staying in the hotel. From the moment I was greeted at check-in with freshly baked cookies I knew it was going to be a good stay. I had a king room with a view of Canal Street and the Mississippi River. It was a large, clean room with tons of counter space in the bathroom and a large flat-screen television. The hotel is in perfect location to the main attractions in the city...I could be on the riverfront or in the French Quarter within 5 minutes of walking! We met the main people on staff in a meeting and each one of them was friendly and truly seemed to care about us and our stay. Any questions or concerns we had were immediately addressed. In fact, I didn't meet a member of the staff who wasn't friendly and didn't greet me. Many of the staff would even take time to just chat or help me find places to go eat. It was such a positive experience staying at this hotel that I would definitely stay again if I return to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: ajc418
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Doubletree we were treated with respect and kindness. The staff offered advice on local places to eat and visit in order to soak up the unique culture of the Cresent City. The location of the hotel made it easy for us to walk to each of these attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: northernOhioHomer
Reviews.Content: I have served in Youth Gatherings for over 30 years and have never had a better experience than what I did in New Orleans and the Doubletree. The most effecient and courteous staff ever encountered. Smiles galore. Always helpful. Ready 24/7 to meet my needs and the needs of the other guests. From top management to daily cleaning staff - all were friendly and helpful. When I return to New Orleans, the Doubletree is the first place I will check for rooms. Great location, clean and friendly! The best!

Reviews.Title: “It was a very relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: fyo995
Reviews.Content: It was an extremely fun and exciting stay. The service was great the whole time. Also, the Hotel itself and the room looked to be well maintained. The a/c unit was working great which allowed me to sleep like a baby.

Reviews.Title: “This is what your looking for in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: jpslzr
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. The customer service shined daily. Location was prime, and the staff always had a good answer to our questions. The rooms were very spacious and not overcrowded with amenities "for sale". When we return this will be our hotel of choice. Thank you for an unforgettable weekend!

Reviews.Title: “The employees at Double Tree created an awesome experience.”
Reviews.Author: Blaster_b
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the Riverside Hilton or Hilton on St. Charles Street. Only by chance I stayed at the Double Tree. WOW-- !! Half the price in some cases - Double the service and more than anything when the maids, Parking attendants, Front Desk , and Manager calls me by my full name and treats me as if I were royalty --well I'll never stay anywhere else when I am in New Orleans. I spend about 4 months out of the year in a hotel and its stretched throughout North and South America and by far this was my best experience (No Kidding). Great Job to all of you and you gusy are the best !! Respectfully, Ben S.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & the entire staff were awesome!”
Reviews.Author: coastalintl
Reviews.Content: FOr any business traveler or if your just getting away, I have stayed at this location for both business & pleasure. You never have to take a taxi anywhere, all is right there, many places to eat, casino's, bars, clubs, you name it and it's all within a few blocks. When I stayed there for business we were working at the New Orleans convention center, I walked to & from everyday. Thanks again for another wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was REALLY nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: ImmaAtDaBeach
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where ya'll stayed who have given this hotel bad reviews.... We just got back from a 2 night stay and it was perfect. The staff was VERY attentive & friendly from the Valet attendant, the Bell Hop, to the front desk staff. And...YES the cookies were yummy and warm. The view of the river/city from our 14th floor room was outstanding!! The room was exceptionally clean and the beds were VERY comfortable. We were on a 1527 mile drive from Victoria, TX to Carolina Beach, NC and comfort was THE most important thing... The walls did not seem thin...in fact, we were beside the elevators and didnt even hear them. We never did hear a rogue toilet flush but maybe once but that was while I was IN our bathroom...didnt hear the TV next door or voices from out in the hallway.... GREAT stay! We'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff to take care of you”
Reviews.Author: Treker138
Reviews.Content: The Doubltree is located near so many attractions, we hardly ever needed a cab the whole time we were there. Clean rooms that were well maintained were a treat to come home to after a long day. I never experienced one issue or problem the entire time I was there, from a warm a welcoming check-in (with a great cookie!) to an efficent check-out. I would certainly reccomend the hotel to anyone I knew that was traveling to the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras 2009 visit to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: LawmanNewOrleans_La_
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was well maintained and equipped. Breakfast each morning in Lafitte's was very good-good selection for buffet and cooked to order omelets. The location was on the main street where many of the parades passed, and just adjacent to the French Quarter. We did not experience any problems during our stay. What we liked best about our stay was the professional demeanor of the staff. They were all kind to us, greeted us cheerfully each day, inquired as to our satisfaction, and seemed genuinely interested in our welfare. I look forward to another stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad it was FREE”
Reviews.Author: 123forme
Reviews.Content: We had a free offer from Harrah's Casino. The hotel looks nice but the linens were dirty. It is a really basic hotel and not on the luxury side. But it did have new carpet which can be a real PLUS. The curtain in the room looked like a child got a chance to put their boogers on it. One couple at the hotel told me they got the room for $54 on priceline. The room was worth that but not worth more than about $85. Valet for one night ran over $35. The beds were comfortable. BIG PLUS!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lagirlintexas
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for so many different reasons. It has by far the best location in all of New Orleans. Easy access to everything New Orleans has to offer. The rooms were outstanding....4 women to a room can be quite a nightmare but not here. The beds were to die for and we had enough space for all of us to get ready. The view of the Mississippi River from our room was beautiful. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. I love the Star Bucks coffee shop which was very much needed the mornings after staying out all night on Bourbon Street and Harrah's Casino which is next door...could you ask for anything more. Some of the women had room service and ate the breakfast buffet Lafitte's offered and they all said it was delicious. I will definitely be staying here year after year for our Jazz Fest weekend and any time I decide to come and visit New Orleans. I recommend this hotel to all of my friends who are planning trips to New Orleans. Oh, can't forget the warm cookies that we were treated to when we were checking in. I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the Hilton Brand”
Reviews.Author: jimrusssauer
Reviews.Content: Just Stayed at the Doubletree Hotel in New Orleans. I wish I would have believed all the previous reviews, but I thought, it is part of the Hilton Brand and is supposed to be better than the Hampton Inns and lower Hilton Brand Hotels. Well it is not even close to being as good as a Hampton Inn or Hilton Garden Inn. The rooms are tiny, bathroom extremely small, and Incredibly Loud. As the other reviewers noted and it is true the walls are paper thin, the Toilet flush can be heard from rooms down the hall and the most annoying thing is the doors are steel and slam shut anytime someone leaves the room. So all night we heard doors slamming and toilets flushing. The Website gives pictures of a nice lobby etc. with a paino, there is no lobby, no piano, and no place to sit. I found the staff nice but overwhelmed. I have traveled for business for the last 20 years and this hotel ranks in my top 5 of worse places I have stayed. I expected a lot more from a mid level Hilton Brand Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room was free, but would have paid for night at Harrah's”
Reviews.Author: TravelerBelAir_MD
Reviews.Content: My husband is a member of Harrah's Total Rewards program. We were allowed 3 free nights at Harrah's, and one at Doubletree. Would have paid for the extra night at Harrah's instead of staying here for the first night. Room smelled of mold and mildew even on the 14th floor. Only one person could fit in the bathroom at a time, since the toilet was in the way of the door. Rust on towel rack in tub. Only way this was tollerable, was after spending the day at Jazz Fest. Couldn't wait to take a shower at Harrah's when we checked in there the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Hestitate to Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: cuddaqueen
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the bathrooms ARE miniscule, but just how much room do you need? Sure you can reach the sink from the toliet or the shower but didn't really think it was too much of a problem. We visited for 3 nights in February, 6th trip to NOL, 1st stay at Doubletree and I am hard pressed to find anything to complain about. Most boutique hotel rooms in NOL are smaller. We did have a corner room at the end of a hallway so I'm sure that helped with the noise, but again, you ARE in New Orleans and "Laissez Les Bon Temps Roulez". Staff was very helpful, location is perfect. No complaints here. Would I stay again? Sure. Usually try to stay at a different hotel each trip so I probably won't be staying here again, but it would not be because the hotel was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Cali4nia
Reviews.Content: After reading several poor reviews I was not expecting much from this hotel. Since I was using Hilton Honor Points, I figured I'd just deal with noise and substandard accomodations. I was very happy to find a clean, quiet and well layed out room. The Hotel is located right next to Harrah's Casino and is a short walk to the French Quarter. The only disadvantage I could find was that the bathroom was small. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “What a shame”
Reviews.Author: onirrac
Reviews.Content: went to new orleans for a wedding , great location but what a hole !room was s,all smelly , dated missing wall paper,broken shower,broken dresser,,when neighor flushes toilet we had the pleasure of seeing it , SHOWER HEAD WAY TO LOW, AND YES PAPER THIN WALLS , NOT VERY RESTFULL PLACE , BUT IF YOUR NOT GOING THERE TO SLEEP OR RELAX, THEN THIS IS THE HOTEL FOR YOU , ITS NEXT TO THE CASINO ! AND A FEW BLOCKS FROM FRNCH QTR

Reviews.Title: “Even if your conference takes place here, stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlike
Reviews.Content: Smoke and mold have contaminated every room, even those labelled non-smoking. The toilets are extremely loud and as others have noted, the walls are so thin you can hear everything that happens in the rooms next to you as well as in the hallways. Service was also minimal both at the front desk and in the rooms. The vending machine was not maintained, and the cleaning staff did not do a thorough job at all. Even if your conference takes place here, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....but”
Reviews.Author: fitznorton
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Doubletree Hotel on Canal Street. Location was very good as it was near the Convention Center and French Quarter. The room was clean but the bathroom was extremely small. I was awoken a few times during the night with fellow guests closing their doors. Valet parking was $32 per day......ridiculous! Would I recommend this hotel? Only if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “They're skating on their location.”
Reviews.Author: Mslia
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST location for Mardi Gras. Parades went right by the hotel most days. Just don't bring a car. That being said, what a crappy Doubletree. Thin walls, too much noise. Tiniest closet I've ever seen in a hotel. Small bathroom. I'm a very petite person and I found the shower head too low and am bruised from bumping into doorknobs, counter etc. Shower changed temp from tepid to scalding every 10 - 30 seconds. Toilet was just like in a public bathroom. No tank and a foot kick flush. Shower curtain was broken, so puddles on the floor every day. Coffee cups paper one day, styrofoam the next. Never any hand/body lotion. Asked for shower cap 3 different days, received once. Do not pay for Wifi. The hotel next door has it free. Just look for Windsor Court and agree to their terms. A little slow, but not $12.00. All local calls $1.00. This is one of the few occasions it might be nice to have a cell. Bed pretty comfortable. Staff friendly and kind. Would I stay here again? Probably not, but the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “just awful-big ripoff”
Reviews.Author: roamin1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for last 3 days of Mardi Gras. It began with the fact that it took almost 5 hours after we arrived from out of town to gain access because streets were blocked off.(not their fault). But when we arrived (reserved of course), there was no room in the valet parking( which is $36 a day and the only parking they have. So I was told to park (for a discounted rate) a good 10 min. walk away in the shopping center and walk back to the hotel at 1:30 in the am. (right,NOT!). We didn't recieve the famous cookie at check-in that they pride themselves on. In the room, the thermostat didn't work, the water in the shower was lukewarm, but the water in the basin was scalding hot. The complimentary coffee cups were unwrapped and dirty. We asked for more.A young man in regular street clothes (no uniform) brought them right away, however these cups were unwrapped as well. The room looked a bit run-down, small, very basic. It was not the caliber you would expect from the Doubletree name. Definitely not woth the $169-$329 price tag. It was $289 when we stayed. Not even a complimentary Continental breakfast. But you could get a muffin and coffee from the rest. downstairs for about $6, Please! This hotel wasn't worth more than $79 by any standard. Best thing about it was the location. It definitely gives Doubletree a bad name, if I were CEO of the company, I'd take the name off.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MS_TINA_5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Hotel New Orleans for the first time on February 14, 2009. The good: check in was quick, the rooms were comfortable and very clean. I forgot some amenities and staff were very quick to respond with bringing up what I needed. All staff were very polite. One bad: the walls are paper thin, you can literally hear every word in the rooms next to you and in the hallway. I would stay here again for the ideal location, but if you need a good nights rest, reconsider due to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Seems to be back on track”
Reviews.Author: Kduay
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree 3 nights during Mardi Gras and had a great time. It's right on the parade route for most of the downtown parades. Harrah's casino is right next door. Cross the street and you're in the French Quarter - one of the most interestingly beautiful arreas of any city you'll ever visit. The room was very comfortable and spacious - quite a difference in the room we had there in December. Front desk staff is friendly even though they seem a bit undertrained. There's a pretty good bar and a decent restaurant right in the hotel. Elevators are quick and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: gbpinpdx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient, right across the street from Harrah's and a six-block or so walk to Bourbon Street. The hotel felt a bit rundown and the rooms were small and a bit beat up. Shower heads are too low and two of the three days my shower was luke-warm at best. In fairness, it did look like the hotel was remodeling part of the lobby, so maybe they are starting to update the entire place. I was there for three nights and throughout the middle of each night there always seemed to be staff walking the halls with their walkie talkies on very loud. Nice to have staff around, but maybe earpieces for the radios would be appropriate to not wake the guests. While the staff was not rude, they certainly couldn't be considered warm and friendly. Typically at Hiltons, the staff has worked hard to please. At this property, it felt like I was an inconvenience for them. The overall attitude was melancholy. It's almost as if they felt beaten down, or defeated. We paid $199 per night. The hospitality staff tried to ping us for $500 a night for a small conference room. Instead, we booked the same room online from the Hilton website for $150. Internet charges were $11.99 a night, and the wireless worked quite well as they should for that price. Definitely a mediocre stay at best. I likely won't be staying here again as there are other places very close by that I'll try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Find someplace else to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Biztraveler1313
Reviews.Content: This is quite possibly the worst Hilton/Doubletree experience I have ever had. The customer service is horrible and the staff seems to think they are doing you a favor by even showing up to work. The rooms are tiny, smell like smoke (I had to ask for another because the first room was so bad, the second one was only a minor improvement in the smoke smell) and the showers dont have hot water. Management obviously doesnt care about the customer's experience. They do not do anything special for anyone, including HHonors diamond members. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere cleaner where they value their customers. You will not find it here.

Reviews.Title: “take earplugs!!”
Reviews.Author: shopperlibby
Reviews.Content: I was there for a business conference. The location was great, the staff gracious, the beds comfortable and the entire place was clean. Now previous reviews stated the walls were paper thin they were so right! I am not a light sleeper but when the alarms went off in the adjourning rooms it woke me up. You could hear EVERY noise! The rooms were cramped and the bathroom was tiny you could not open or shut door if you sat on the toilet. For one person it was fine. Our conference ended a day early and I contacted the desk the night before to let them know and get a room total. The next morning I went to check out and was told there was a 75.00 cancellation fee for changing my reservation after check in. I was not happy. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: crabbyannie
Reviews.Content: We booked a girls getaway at the Doubletree because we had free rooms there thru Harrahs. We were not dissapointed. The location can not be beat. Just across the street from the casino and on Canal street ina very safe location. All we had to do was walk across the street a up a few blocks and we were on Bourbon. Short walk to Jackson Square, but away from all the noise of the quarter. The beds are to die for. The bathrooms are very small, but we didn't go to stay in the bathroom. All of the staff we meet were very young and very on the ball. Got some great tips for dinner. They were very nice and accomodating. We would and will go back there. On the 12th floor you can see a lot. We had breakfast in the hotel one m orning and it was great. Had a good buffett and some of us order some great waffles. Give these folks a try.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What Accurate Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: EarplugLover
Reviews.Content: It was hard for me to believe, but the previous reviewers totally weren't making it up! Here's the checklist: Paper-thin walls with loud "neighbors": check. Toilets that sound like 747s: check. Sloppy housekeeping: check (found trash behind a chair - ew!). Weird room damage: check. Claustrophobia inducing rooms and baths: check. Non-functioning thermostat: check. Falling towel bars: check (and beware!). The staff wasn't quite as heinous as others have described them. We found the front desk personnel and valets to be quite helpful, but based on other travelers' advice, we skipped room service and kept our expectations low. The only reason we stayed at the Doubletree was because the room was comped by Harrah's, and all their other hotel partners were full. Frankly, it's the only reason I'd stay there again. In a down economy, free is good, but of course, that old adage, "you get what you pay for" is so true. If you do end up stuck at the Doubletree, bring earplugs so you can get a good night's sleep. Hey, at least the Hilton-style beds are very, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A 30.00 difference make a whole lotta difference!!!!”
Reviews.Author: customersdomatter
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to be in new orleans for bayou classic weekend which happened to be thanksgiving weekend. After searching for hotels I decided me and my best friend would stay at the Marriott which is where I always stay when I am in New Orleans and i love it. However after us discussing what events we would take part in we wanted to find a room within the same price range but closer to Harrah's. I contacted Doubletree and was quoted a price of a 30.00 cheaper rate combined for both nights. I was advised that a deposit equilavent to 1 night's stay and that it was non refundable but it would gurantee your room requested.My requested promised room was a double queen bed room. I was also advised that there is parking available at a rate of 35.00. Now i should have taken into consideration that even reservations wasn't all that courteous but I let it ride thinkin that they had a busy day maybe? I can't blame the congestion of the city on the hotel but when I arrived to "valet" there was no one who you would think is "vale" since there is no specific attire or signs worn? I then asked somebody i seen with keys where do I go to valet and was then told they were not valeting anymore since it was full. I asked where am I suppose to park and I was told where to so that took another 30 minutes. After walking with my luggage through a parking garage, thru the mall, cross thru Harrah's front walkway and to the hotel me and my friend waited in line. We were finally acknoledged with do you have a reservation I stated yes and provided the needed information. The representative then stated that her co worker will finish heloing me . Now correct me if I am wrong if I have already paid one night prior to arrival and have a set reservation you would think it would be a speedy process. That is not the case the lady was typing and clicking for 15 minutes, then gave us our keys, and told us our room number. No thanks you, didn't ask any questions while she was typing, nothing. When me and my friend arrive to our room to our suprise it is a 1 queen size bed room! I contacted front desk and was told that my deposit does not guarantee bedding arrangments it just promises you a room and after requesting the supervisor I was told they were gone for the day. This was a HUGE inconvience seeing it as there are 2 woman with plenty of items cramped in a room. Front desk stated they would seend a roll bed up to our room but i was puzzled as to where would it fit seeing as to how small the room was. Housekeeping broght the bed and she was the friendliest of the whole staff. She didn't undrestand why it was requested because it was NO WHERE for the pull out bed to fit. There was no apology from front desk nor did she advise us when we was down stairs that our room was a single. I contacted corporate the next day and was told that my reservation was modified right when i checked in and no explanation was given. I filed a complaint report which is currently in progress of being taken care of. All of the reviews about un friendly staff, thin walls ecause i could hear conversations even while i was talking, you can also smell somebody using the restroom as if the air vents was connected to their toilets, and the doors open and close as if it is your door. I was disgusted and [-] that my weekend was in a cramped hotel with bad service and hope that management fixes the problem because unhappy guess don't return they just add up.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: OregonMember
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in New Orleans and the DoubleTree Hotel was one of several hotels being utilized (with a conference rate). The hotel is next to the Harrah's Casino and on the other side of Canal Street and the French Quarter. It is also a short walk to the river, the shops in the RiverWalk, and the aquarium. Being near the French Quarter and its restaurants, galleries and shops without dealing with the noise that sometimes comes with a hotel in the Quarter was the primary reason for choosing the DoubleTree. The standard room is rather small, particularly the bathroom - the bathroom door opens and misses the toilet by a couple of inches. But the room was clean and nicely decorated. The staff were friendly and helpful, with one exception: room service. On our last evening in town - with an early departure the next morning - my wife and I decided to stay in and order from room service. We were told it would be 30-40 minutes; an hour later I called and was told they had the wrong room number - did I still want the order? Since we were pretty hunger, I said "Yes". Unfortunately, when the it finally arrived, the food was cold. On another occasion, I ordered a sandwich and beer; the beer was unopened and required a bottle opener which required another call to room service for an opener. The room service staff just didn't seem to have their act together. Overall, I liked the location, the room was clean, and the rate seemed reasonable (approx. $150.00/night). I just wouldn't order room service.

Reviews.Title: “Lost and found”
Reviews.Author: traveltimenc
Reviews.Content: My daughter stayed here on a recent group trip and left her orthodontic retainer in the room. We never thought we would see it again, but management called and kindly shipped it to our home UPS. According to my daughter, the beds were extremely comfortable and the location was great, a block down from the Ritz Carlton. Thanks Doubletree. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Honors Members -Do not Stay Here--”
Reviews.Author: jsmith72113
Reviews.Content: For all you Hilton Honors members out there Do not stay here!!!!!!!! See below bottom line. 1. 1st Room the sill rotted and fallen off the window. See Attached picture 2. 2nd Room no towells 3. Both room water bottles and other normal HHonors stuff did not exsist. 4. Even though this is the slowest time in New Orleans no room upgrade. 5. $32 dollar parking fee for a $109 room - Thats 29% of the stay for parking 6. Only feather pillows on the bed. 7. No smoking room smelled of terrible smoke. 8. A/C was limited to 72 degrees according to their t-stat. All of this was communicated to Todd Chambers (General Manager) I was told they manage their hotel pricing for the market and no special treatment would be given to hilton honors members. I thought that was what the program was all about. To be fair they did bring some water up after I discovered no towells. (found this after I got out of the shower) Don't Stay Here

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the DoubleTree”
Reviews.Author: CSL63
Reviews.Content: We made a relatively last minute trip to New Orleans the first weekend in May. Being a Harrahâ€™s rewards card holder, I called them to get a room, and, with the Jazz Fest going on, they were sold out, but the best deal they could find was the DoubleTree, right across the street from Harrahâ€™s. This was our â€œmini honeymoon,â€� as we just got married, but weâ€™re not taking our real honeymoon for a while. Harrahâ€™s reservation agent was very excited for us, and noted that it was our honeymoon on our reservation with the DoubleTree so they could do "something special for us" - her words, not mine. When we arrived in town, we waited in line for valet parking for 10-15 minutes, watching two valet parkers come and go, but never being acknowledged. Finally, after I got out, one came to the door to tell us that the garage was completely full, but they could give us a discount coupon for another garage. He told us they have over 300 rooms in the hotel, but only 100 spaces, so the valet sells out, especially on busy weekends. We didnâ€™t overreact, though, since we saw a bunch of kids coming in their prom attire, and knew the jazz fest was going on. Downtown New Orleans parking is tight. Strike one. Leaving our key with the valet so we could check in, we walked into the hotel to find four people behind the counterâ€¦ but we had to wait anyway. When it was our turn, the agent found our reservation very efficiently, and got us checked in just fine. However, she didnâ€™t smile onceâ€¦ it was then that we realized that nobody behind the counter was smiling. No pleasantries, no â€œwelcome to New Orleans,â€� or even a â€œhave a nice stayâ€� or â€œthank you for staying with us.â€� No mention of our honeymoon. We did get the famous DoubleTree cookies, but they werenâ€™t warm at all. The best description of their attitude was indifference. Other adjectives include uncaring, surly, and just plain rude. Strike two. When we got to the room, it looked fine. The rooms are small, and our room only had a queen bed, even though we had requested a king. The furnishings were nice, and appeared to be recently updated. The bathroom counter, as well as the dresser top and coffee table top were granite, the furniture was real wood. The room was clean, with the exception of the TV â€“ it was smeared, like it was cleaned with a dirty rag, and one towel rack in the bathroom is half torn off the wall. But, as another reviewer said, the toilet sounds like a large plane. With engine trouble. Maybe even an engine fire, with a large bird sucked into the engine. Maybe even an ostrich. Also, the walls and doors are beyond thin. When the person in the next door opens and closes his door, you jump because you think someone is coming into your room. And the doors are loud â€“ they close by themselves, and slam when they shut. Strike three. We took this all in stride, since, as they say, â€œevery hotel room looks the same with your eyes closed.â€� Saturday morning, we decided to sleep in. However, at 7:46, two housekeepers were yelling to each other in the hall, and letting those loud doors slam. Strike four. I should have been counting. After we finally woke up (again), we ordered room service for breakfast. It did take the full 30-45 minutes that we were quoted, and it was our server who had the best attitude of any staff we met. She was friendly, smiled, and joked with us. However, my fried eggs were not cooked right, the grits had been sitting and formed a crust on the top, and our soft drink and orange juice were served in the plastic bottles, with no glasses or ice. Strike five. I really should have been counting. After a day of being lazy, it was time to get cleaned up and get out. I started the water for the shower, and noted how nice the water pressure was. Got the temperature right, and noticed that the tub was now alarmingly full, even though the drain was open. I decided it wasnâ€™t that big of a deal, so I pull the diverter knob to turn on the shower, and it came off in my hand. That was enough. I called the care line (dialed 44 on the phone) and was told engineering would be up in â€œa few minutes.â€� After 40 minutes, we called again to be told that engineering was backed up, but he was taking a remote to another room, and would be up in ten minutes. After almost 20 minutes more, another call got another promise. Luckily, he showed up within 5 minutes after that, apologizing because he was on the only one on call for the hotel. He was the second staff member who was polite, and I did feel sorry for him. It took him a second trip to bring back the parts, and we finally had a working shower! Repeated calls to talk to talk to the manager resulted in â€œsheâ€™s at lunch.â€� Left messages for her to call us back, but that didnâ€™t happen. We did get a call offering two free dinners downstairs, two free breakfasts the next morning, and a tin of cookies. We passed on the dinner, since we had plans to go out. Plus, we had eaten their breakfast that morning, so we had an idea what weâ€™d be in store for. The only good news about this stay (besides the cookies) was that, when we went to pay, we found that we were not charged for the room â€“ only internet and room service. Still, no apologies, no, â€œIâ€™m very sorry about the problems you experienced, therefore we wonâ€™t charge you for your room.â€� Once again, the best description you could use for the staffâ€™s attitude is indifference. I present all these facts as just facts â€“ this was a story that happened to me, and that doesnâ€™t mean that everyone will have the same experience. One, two, or maybe even three things could just be a coincidence. (I lost track of how many strikes this hotel had.) However, all these events seem to show a pattern of mismanagement and poor customer service. There are far too many good hotels in New Orleansâ€¦ I wonâ€™t be back to this one. And, Iâ€™ve learned my lesson â€“ ALWAYS check TripAdvisor before you travel!
